description:
Disclaimer: this is the restaurant were I met my wife so it's a special one for me :)

I like their sushi's. Last time I had double hamachi and Hawaii. 

 They also have a good service.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Being experienced with excellent sushi, this sushi restaurant did not have good sushi.
I had three rolls and all three were lack luster.
My waitress was nice but all business. 
The prices were ok, but definitely not worth it.
The ambience was nice.
author: Letter W.

description:
Huge disappointment with the quality of their sushi. I was here with a buddy and we ordered:

Edamame: Didn't taste fresh. 
Gyoza: Just OK but best part of a very disappointing meal.

Crab special roll: This roll was disgusting. The crab was bland and it just tasted like a fried piece of mush in between some cucumber and rice. This roll tasted like something you would get out of a buffet that had some sushi on it.

Volcano Roll: Actually, this roll was worse than the crab roll. A typical volcano roll has spicy tuna on top (hence the volcano in the name) of a shrimp tempura roll. The roll served was a California roll with a glob of spicy mayo that was baked. I literally peeled off the quarter inch mayo layer to eat a few pieces and just couldn't anymore.

My buddy had a simple tuna avocado and salmon avocado and I should've just kept it simple. I felt nauseous afterwards as well. I hate giving bad reviews but sometimes, they're warranted. As is the case here.
author: Alex B.

description: I've been here several times because it's the closest sushi place to my work, but I'd probably be a happier person if I walked an extra 3 blocks and went somewhere that had better food. Overall this place is too expensive for what they serve. And sometimes it takes an absurdly long time to get your food. I waited 40 min for two rolls the other day and ended up having to take most of it to go because I needed to head back to work. Service is also lackluster. They're friendly enough but move very slowly. I also feel like they don't follow their own hours because I've tried to come by several times when I work late and they're never open when they say they should be. I've had several coworkers say the same thing.
author: Jessica F.

description:
My 22 year old son recommended this place because he had been here once before for the happy hour. I was a little concerned because it is right outside the gates of Chinatown near Union Square, so screamed "tourist trap" to me. After grabbing an OpenTable reservation, we were promptly seated, and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the sushi.

I ordered the 12 piece chef's selection, which included three cuts of tuna and uni (sea urchin), and a delightful sardine. My son ordered a couple of rolls and crab nigiri, and one of the staff (not our waiter) came over later to offer him king crab instead, which he got and was very happy with. (They also offered me live uni, which I declined!)

Although there were 4 people working the floor and our waiter was just busting his ass the whole time we were there, the service was a bit slow and disjointed. There was confusion about dessert and I did get a bit antsy waiting for our check. The restaurant fits 45 people max, and there were about 40 people eating while we were there, but it seemed more of an organizational issue than a too few staff issue.
author: David Y.

description:
This restaurant was great! Good service, and I enjoyed the rolls. 

We went on the 4th of July, so it was not too crowded. They sat us immediately and were very present throughout the whole meal - it wasn't hard at all to get their attention and they checked on us frequently. We started with miso soup, which is usually my favorite part of a sushi meal. However, the soup was a bit too fishy for my taste. My boyfriend and I then shared 3 rolls: the Dragon, the Volcano, and the Spicy Salmon/cucumber. The Dragon was amazing! It was cooked very well. The Volcano was a bit of a mess. It's hard to separate the rolls since it comes in one clump. It tastes great, but it's hard to eat. I wouldn't recommend it on a first date. And lastly, the Spicy Salmon/Cucumber roll was great - my traditional favorite.

Overall, I enjoyed this place, but I probably would choose a different sushi place if given the option.
author: Remy B.

description:
TL;DR Overpriced sushi in FiDi

Mikaku is conveniently located in FiDi/DT, but not the place for quality sushi. I shared two rolls and a chicken teriyaki with my bf, and the total ended up at $60, averaging out to $20 a dish. All of the dishes were average, nothing spectacular. For the quality and quantity, the price was definitely not worth it. However, this is Fidi, hence the price. I really wanted sushi, but this was not the best option. There are better options elsewhere.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Had a To-go order to be picked up. Came back with the wrong order and very expensive udon. $24 for a nebanyaki udon!
Why does the receipt say Oakland, Ca. ?? When the location is in San Francisco?
author: Debbie Y.

description: Was relatively empty during lunch hour which is not a good sign. Got the 9 piece ngiri. The salmon was good but the others tasted a little fishy. They had fresh wasabe which was cool. Did not the find the food was worth the $$ and the employees looked bored.
author: Sunil R.

description: Very quaint restaurant. Service was great and fish was very fresh. Fantastic beer selection, not just the typical Japanese beers.
author: Joseph G.

description:
This restaurant was great! Good service, and I enjoyed the rolls.

Rolled through one night after a few drinks with coworkers and enjoyed the experience. They sat us immediately and were very engaged throughout the whole meal - it wasn't hard at all to get their attention and they checked on us frequently. 

Tried again several times since and the service and quality have been consistent.
author: Marc M.

description:
I mean it's a good spot for sashimi, sushi, sake and nigiri, don't get me wrong, but (yes, there is a but) it was just plain solid.

Got the rolls and everything freshly served.  

Drinks are a bit over priced here when one can get beer and wine in this vicinity a bit on happy hour prices.  

Dim place.  Aye okay!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Simple lunch: ordered the bento box (tonkatsu and spicy roll) came with miso soup and salad. The rice which came with the bento box was lukewarm (must be a thing here in SanFran). For a quick lunch it was decently priced. We still felt rushed/hurried by the waitress even though there weren't many people present (probably two other couples and one single top).
author: Brittanie W.

description:
Huge disappointment.  My kids and I were in town looking for some authentic Japanese food close to our hotel.  We found this place on OpenTable and booked a big table since we were meeting friends from the city.

We started with edamame.  Hard to screw up but easy to make good.  Nothing but steamed pods in a dish for $4.  We had 2 of those.

Had some sushi rolls pre-entree, and the presentation was like something you'd get from Safeway at lunch.  Not impressive at all.  Main dishes were a step up, the noodles and the terayaki were good, not anything to go back for.

Service was awful.  Our waiter disappeared halfway through dinner (to his credit he took some great pictures of our table when we asked for shots), but we ended with a waitress who seemed pissed off that she had to cover him.  She should have been happy as they included gratuity. FYI-- I would have left 20% but since you tagged us at 18%, you lose.

I would not recommend this place.
author: Matt G.

description:
I have to write this review to say how blown away I was with my entire dining experience at Mikaku!  

Came here with coworkers.  Just a quick walk up Grant from Market.  Very promptly seated.  The menu has all of the typical items that I look for at a Japanese restaurant:  chicken karaage, agedashi tofu, sushi, tempura, udon, soba, beef, chicken, Salmon teriyaki, donburi, and obento!  

I tried the nabeyaki but instead of udon I wanted soba.  Coworker had the beef teriyaki donburi.  

Each meal came with green salad and miso soup.  What struck me was wow the salad dressing was heavenly!  It wasn't your run of the mill watered down soy dressing.  It was full of flavor and actually had body to it.

Tasha the owner came by several times to say hi and check in on us!  Pleasantly surprised to find that she opened the restaurant due to her own allergies and because of that they don't use MSG and offer a full gluten menu with 12 separate cutting boards in the kitchen!

Back to the food... Ok I have not had broth this heavenly in a very long time.  Probably not since living in Japan.  My nabeyaki came with tempura that was light & flakey and a big healing bowl of my soba.  Little pools of delectable unctuous goodness.

Do yourself a favor and give Mikaku a try.  Definitely making this hidden gem a regular eating establishment!
author: Alicia W.

description:
Having spent an afternoon at Union Square, we dropped in for an early dinner. The waitress seated us and took our order promptly. I noticed there was only one sushi chef behind the counter, but there were only a few other tables occupied so it seemed fine. 

We ordered some sushi rolls which should be pretty simple. After 10 minutes, our first item, a volcano sushi roll, was brought to us. The presentation was awful. It looked like a small clump of rice with a thick sauce on top, served in a wrinkled tin foil. It looked less appetizing than reheated leftovers.

It took another 10 minutes for the rest of our rolls to be served. These other rolls were no better. The rolls were small, and the rice was rolled so poorly that you could see the nori from the outside of the rolls where it should have been rolled with rice.

The ginger served with the rolls were fine, and the restaurant was clean. It's not the waitress's fault. She didn't apologize for the food taking so long or the presentation, but she did refill our water. For that, they get 2 stars.
author: Peter K.

description:
We came here after the Giants and Nationals baseball game.  The restaurant is small, seats about maybe 25-30 people.  

My girlfriend got us a table for 3.  There was one waiter and it took him about 15 minutes to see what we wanted. 

A few minutes later, he asks us to move tables because someone had called in a reservation for 10.  I didn't understand, we should've have had to move just because a reservation was called in. 

He didn't show any type of appreciation. Anyways, we moved and then he came and took our order.
author: Aprilyn P.

description:
We were walking around Union Square and my son really wanted some sushi for lunch. Tired and hungry we found Mikaku downtown really close to the Chinatown entrance. 

As you walk in, I was surprised this place was so tiny. Not too big. With a fair amount of tables and a sushi bar. Anyways, we were told to find a table and our server with be right with us. 

I was so happy that they had a lunch special menu. Looking at it I couldn't help but order the bento box. You can order one or two items. I went for the Tonkatsu and tempura. It came with a salad, rice and miso soup. Not a bad deal. Tonkatsu was pretty good. Nice and crispy on the outside and really good tempura. Even got two shrimp tempura. Nicely cooked and good. Not a bad lunch special. 

My wife got the tempura Soba. She really like the soup on a cold day. She like the Soba noodles and the tempura. No leftovers for her. She liked it a lot. 

My son got his usual. Rainbow roll and my daughter got her dragon roll. They both liked it and thought that the fish was very fresh. No complaints here. Got a bite of the dragon roll and it was really good. 

So the service was good but not too friendly. Wasn't a lot of ambiance. Nothing stood out to me. Everyone eating here was really quiet. Just minding their own business and enjoying the food. 

So the lunch specials were pretty good. Sushi fresh and good service. If your looking for a nice and quiet lunch then this is the place. Enjoy.
author: Doug T.

description: Slow food service, 19 bucks for piece of chicken, dirty house... You can buy the same cake in the Chinese super market with $10 for 12 frozen pieces....  Two people spending about $50 got two small dishes.
author: Tino W.

description: Really overpriced for what it is. Didn't love the flavor either. A tiny side soup and a single roll order cost me $30 after tip.
author: Jackson W.

description: Worst rolls ever  falling apart, very little fish, and just poorly done in general. When mentioned, they still charged me for it. Not good.
author: Julia A.

description:
Worst service in the world. Very disappointing. We were pretty confident that our waiter/bus boy was stoned out of his mind. 

1. The place was not crowded and it took the waiter over 15mins to even come to our table and get an order for beverages. We had to ask several times for water as well which wasn't delivered until much later. 
2. He didn't bring us plates or utensils upon delivering two appetizers. Asked but never received. I finally got up and went into the kitchen myself to grab them. 
3. Next, he did not ever bring us our rolls. We waited for nearly an hour. We soon found out that he forgot to put in our order. We even saw him write it down when we ordered. 
4. Saw a lot of little fruit flies or gnats flying all over our drinks and appetizers. This is highly concerning from a health and cleanliness perspective. 

We will never go here again. Save your money and time and go to a better sushi spot. We can't say anything about the rolls because we ended up just walking out and finding a much better sushi spot --- where service and quality seem to matter more.
author: Ryan S.

description:
My favorite sushi place in SF. Great roll, fantastic sashimi! Chef's choice sashimi is a must dish.

No photos cause I don't have that time.
author: Deng H.

description:
This is the LOUDEST restaurant I've EVER stepped into! It wasn't even because the 49ers game was on - there was barely anyone watching! Every sound just bounced off the walls! It made it very hard to converse with my friend from across the tiny 2-person table. I could barely hear our waiters.

It was also weird because I'm sure the waiter brought around a large glass bottle of water and two small cups. But after finishing my cup, I realized that the bottle had disappeared and I had to wait for one of the busy waiters to notice my tiny empty cup and refill it.

I ordered the $14 Volcano roll. I didn't expect it to be so tiny. It's the size of 8 mini maki rolls. It wasn't bad but it wasn't spectacular either. I chose it because it was scallops, spicy mayo, and unagi sauce on the top.

It just didn't stand out. And I'd probably forget about this experience if I didn't write a review. So it's super average in my book.
author: Athena C.

description: This place is a bit pricey but I believe that is due to the high quality of fish being served here. We have only had the sushi, so I don't know about the rest of the menu. We eat a lot of sushi, and this is by far one of the best places we've found when it comes to getting fresh, flavorful sushi.
author: John M.

description:
Incredible food & friendly service! We felt right at home after meeting owner Natasha, she shared tips and places to see for our family of 3 traveling aussies, from where to see the Chinese New Year parade, to kid's activities and recommended accupunturist.
If we come back to this part of town this is definitely a stop.
author: Rob W.

description: What a wonderful sushi restaurant...we found a gem right outside our hotel. Great service, so personal and sushi/sashimi was wonderful. Definitely will come back!!
author: Anne R.

description:
Food deserves 4-5 stars, service 3 at best. We had to consistently wave down our server to place our drink order, and then our food order, and then for water refills. It wasn't like the place was super busy not did it appear under-staffed. 

That being said, the food was quite enjoyable. We ordered edamame, a couple of sushi rolls, and one of their udon plates to split for dinner. The edamame was a little under-cooked but that is the only complaint I have about their food. 

If you are able to get there for happy hour (5-7 I believe), they have excellent drink and food specials.
author: Mindi A.

description: Food was absolutely amazing but poor girl was all by herself for lunch rush but still did a pretty darn good job. Beer selection and sake selection was really good.
author: Travis D.

description:
Open tables, no reservation needed, place is cozy and right in front of the Chinatown gate. The place was maybe 3/4 full when we came in on a Sunday night around 7.

The wait for our food was a little long but understandable because there were only like two chefs and one waitress who was super nice. 

We got the dragon roll, Godzilla roll, rainbow roll, and spicy salmon roll plus the coconut green tea. Would highly recommend the tea! Comes in a kettle to share.

The food was pretty solid, a little pricy for what it was (like $17 for the rainbow roll), but that's San Francisco for you! 

Would come here again though.
author: Jed Mariz N.

description: This is a cute little place near Chinatown. They sometimes bring you free mochi ice cream, and that's nice. The sushi is pretty tasty and the price isn't terrible.
author: Carmen C.

description:
We went here for lunch and it was nice and quiet, always appreciated. :) we enjoyed some hot saki which was pretty good and priced ok, a bit high but not super high for big city prices. 

The waiter was attentive but not super friendly. He didn't look very excited to be there, but hey, not everyone wants to be at work all of the time. He was good enough and we didn't wait long for service. 

We enjoyed our bento boxes even though the sushi rolls themselves were on the small side. I ordered the spicy tuna which wasn't spicy at all and I'm not huge into spice. But it lacked quite a bit. The salad was fresh but there was a noticeable absence of dressing quantity which bummed me out because I love love love that dressing! If I were smart, I would've asked for more but thought against it. I had the tofu teriyaki which was flavorful and had a large tofu portion. 

The highlight was the green tea ice cream!!! It was probably some of the best green tea ice cream I've ever had. They sprinkled just he tiniest bit of powdered sugar and even though it wasn't much, added the most delightful extra layer of yummy! If the portions were as good as that green tea ice cream, I could give a fourth star. I know bento boxes aren't meant to be super huge but the sushi rolls and serious lack of dressing bummed me out because they are my favorite parts of the dish! 

It wasn't amazing but it wasn't horrible. It was ok priced.
author: Sarah M.

description: 1 star is to many for this place. We had a reservation and no one even acknowledged up for 10 minutes then we finally got seated and then 25 minutes went by before the manger lady with big hair came up to us and said sorry it's really busy which was funny because they only have like 8 tables in the whole place and like 3 waiters and it wasn't even full. So we ordered another 20 minutes go by and then our food came. It was not good I had gyzos to share and chicken teriyaki and my daughter had a tornado roll which she said was good but not for 16 after we ate I didn't feel good at all. We left and I barely made it back to our hotel before I was violently sick  that place was terrible don't waste your money or time there are so many other great places in the city and this was not it besides do yuh want to be sick from bad food ??
author: Shaunna S.

description: My friends and I came here for a last minute birthday dinner and we WISHED we had reserved a table at a different restaurant! Fortunately, we were seated quickly for a Saturday night in the big city but from what we ordered, we were not impressed :(. I ordered a Rainbow Roll (shrimp tempura topped with tuna, hamachi, salmon, and shrimp), and I must say, I have had this roll at other sushi restaurants with greater quality! Especially for the price of $17. There was minimal rice on the roll which made it look like the restaurant was being skimpy (that's a first) and the quality of the fish provided a less than appealing taste. Nevertheless, it did fill my tummy until I was able to get back to the car to finish off my hot Cheetos. Unfortunately, my friends were also not satisfied with either of their roles and went Yelping for a different food venue to fill their tummies. The service, however, was great hence the two stars. The servers made sure to refill our waters every so often and always came by to check up on how we were doing! I won't be giving this place another try, but hopefully your experience will be better!
author: Harjina S.

description:
We kind of just ended up here with low expectations and they still didn't meet it, lol. Salmon sashimi pieces were thin and sad. We also chose 4 different types of rolls and none are worth mentioning. The sushi didn't taste very fresh and the rice wasn't packed tight enough, leaving to fall somewhat apart

Service was good but they put us at a tiny table. We barely fit everything in the table and I had to sit on the edge. That was pretty annoying.
author: Phi N.

description:
Food: So, my 3-star rating is for the ambiance and service mostly. Perhaps their other dishes are yummy, but the sushi was really unimpressive. We came during happy hour which offers some discounted drinks and simple sushi rolls for about $5. We had a spicy salmon roll and a Chef's Special roll. The quality of the sushi looked like someone new was in the kitchen. The sushi rice was spotty and falling off. The taste of the spicy salmon roll was good though. The Chef's roll is what really disappointed. There was really no description of what was on it by the waitress but it appeared to be shrimp tempura, some veggies, and then imitation crab that was soaked in some kind of red sauce. It wasn't pretty and the flavor was lacking. What's more is that the roll is one of their most expensive ($18) and it really didn't seem like it was worth that.

Ambiance: This place isn't huge, but it's relatively spacious and can accommodate a decent number of smaller parties (2-4). It's clean and has a large sushi bar.

Service: The service here was great. They give you really tiny glasses for water but the waitresses were constantly coming around to refill them. The food came out quickly and they checked on us a few times.
author: Susan G.

description: Food was great! Service?... that's why only 3 stars... we were missing one item and when we asked for it, i could hear them from my table arguing that they had already sent it out... to whom?? The girl had a shitty attitude
author: Elsy C.

description: Best sushi ever!!  We have never had anyone give us such great sake advice & let our taste buds confirm her recommendations.  Loved our waitress!!!!  Additionally, fresh bluefin today... 70 lbs and it in house... AMAZING.   Both of the specialty rolls we ordered were also outstanding.  We felt like the only customers in the restaurant, and we weren't!!  Highly recommend!  Must visit in San Francisco!!
author: Amy F.

description:
Great staff! Great Location! 

We ordered Philly, Rock n' roll classic rolls, Spider and Volcano Rolls, Pork Gyoza and Sapporo Beer and it costs about $61. Enjoyed the food.
author: Kath S.

description:
My friends and I came here after the new year because every otherJapanese and/or ramen house in union square was closed and this happen to be the only one open. Ordered the Agedashi tofu as an appetizer, which was prepared just right. For my main course, I ordered the chiraishi. I was a bit disappointed... The rice was a little hard and the assorted sashimi was ok... It seemed like it wasn't fresh, which is a bummer because I would expect fresh fish at any restaurant that serves sushi, not to mention, this place is located in San Francisco. In addition, for $29, I would be expected more sashimi, but this wasn't the case. 

They were also out of ALL their specialty fish... When does this ever happen?? We came here right when they opened lol. This was January 2. 

Staff were friendly, but would not come here again.
author: Kristel V.

description: Oh man!  The staff here is just so kind.  They actually had recommended foods, but also recommended a nice sake for us to try.  Great food, nice atmosphere - definitely come here again to get some tasty sushi
author: Nicholas F.

description: 2.5 stars. Came here for lunch the other day and the food was nothing to write home about. My friend and I both ordered the tempura udon and it was decent, but really, any Japanese restaurant that botches the art of boiling/prepping udon should be ashamed of themselves. This review seems a bit harsh but overall the food was mediocre. If I didn't work near FiDi, I would not come here to eat. Just for kicks, we also ordered uni. My friend said it wasn't the best, but also not the worst. My uni, however, was fishy..I really tasted the gonads. Lord help me!!! I doubt I'll be back for sushi, I had other coworkers tell me that their sushi was sub par, but I don't think I want to experience it firsthand, pass!
author: Denise L.

description: Great location.  We were at the hotel next door.  I ordered the shrimp tempura noodle soup.  The soup was fresh but it only came with 2 pieces of shrimp for a $15 bowl.  I guess since it's in San Francisco financial district area but still!  The soup base was good.  The salad dressing and salad was amazing!  It was my favorite part of the meal.  Service was good.  Very timely with filling up my water.  I may try sushi next time...  I would probably give this place a 3.5 stars if possible.
author: Shazia M.

description:
DISREGARD ALL REVIEWS LESS THAN 4 STARS! I am a San Francico native, and am familiar with my fair share of restaurants.  Mikaku is by far one of my most desired Japanese cuisines. Dim lighting, and chocolate/ Crimson red decor is a perfect ambiance for a Sunday dinner. Modern/ fresh design, with the perfect blend  of traditional Japanese flare. A restaurant with the right vibe is hard to come by these days and I find this partical place very fullfilling. 
 Now, the food. In short, it's to die for.  This is the only Japanese restaurant I know  (other than Benihanas) that asked how you would like your beef cooked. The owner Tasha spent time sharing her beautiful story of how she came to own a restaurant due to  of a slew of allergies.  This is why she hand picks top quality restaurant ingredients and it shows. Plate presentation is perfection and with that, Mikaku is the ONLY place I can find quality Vietnamese Jasmine tea served in a cast iron tea pot. 
Service is constantly attending to our needs, and even take the time to pour your coca cola for you. From begining to end, this place is  top of line. 
As, a 5 star Hair Salon Manager, I can appreciate the best of the best! Hats off to Mikaku.
author: Camie L.

description: Tasteless Alaskan roll. Even rice had no taste. Go elsewhere. Waitresses were nice. But food left much to be desired, especially for such a basic roll.
author: Dal G.

description: Bumped into this place walking around the financial district. I didn't think much of it at first but when the food arrived.... I thought I definitely wasn't gonna eat the whole salad but the dressing was amazingly good and evenly spread (and that's just the salad), good miso soup (it's the same everywhere In my experience), really good teriyaki chicken (soft and easy to eat), good salad and rice. The chef was really nice and even let me taste some uni and it was reaaaally good and fresh. The guy next to me at the bar was delighted to and made several comments about it. HIGHLY RECCOMENDED! This combo went for $16 and the draft $4.50
author: Andre N.

description: Came in here on a Wednesday evening and we were treated very well by everyone who works here. Reasonable prices, good service, and simple yet fulfilling menu items.  So awesome we came back again 2 nights later. A must if you are in need of some hot sake to pump you up after shopping all day in Union Square.
author: Rach B.

description: Food was good and the service was great! The staff gave good recommendations. I would say the place itself is a bit run down but the value for food and drinks is great. I would go again and definitely recommend to friends visiting.
author: Sidney G.

description: I came here with my bf and my friend. The wait time was not that long, and the price was a bit on the expensive side, dishes were small, wasabi was not spicy. In short- I didn't think the food or service was that great. I thought the service was slow, and they could have done better. I got the bento box with 2 things- CA rolls and teriyaki, there wasn't that much chicken in the dish, and the sushi roll wasn't that great in terms of taste. Salad dressing was also not that great as well. Though I enjoyed the hot green tea.
author: Amy Y.

description:
This was the only restaurant we didn't have to wait in line for. So we were hungry and decided to eat here last night 2-12-2017.  Bf had rainbow roll $17.00 Very disappointed. Sushi was not fresh, imitation sushi, tempora inside was hard and stale.  We asked the waitor if we can switch for something else. He denied our request.  Service was okay.  Im so happy we didn't order more sushi rolls. Edamame was good.  Salmon teriyaki was okay. Thou felt salmon was not really fresh more like frozen salmon from freezer.  

Overall reccommend do not waste your money here. We will not go back.  We saw other customers leaving not happy with their food also.  Very disappointed how they screwed us over with their cheap imitation sushi and salmon.
author: Kellie V.

description:
This is such a tourist trap.

I felt like a trapped fly here since I was desperate for Japanese.

I paid for my desperation with the high prices, small portions, and bland fish here.

I should have picked up a sandwich around the corner instead.

Slow service added to my pain point here, and my co-worker and I were literally running late from eating here that we had to jog back to the office in in our suits.

And the fact that this place wasn't busy left us scratching our heads.
Below average sushi at sky high prices.

Skip this place; locals and tourists alike.
author: Jack R.

description:
Perfect place for a sushi date! Came in around 9 and was greeted by the host and immediately sat. The ambiance is nice, but not too over the top. We started off with the house sake (serves 1-3) for $16- what a great deal for a quality sake!

We ordered the Lion King roll which isn't on the menu, but our waitress knew exactly what we were looking for. I also ordered the chicken teriyaki that was juicy and full of flavor. 

Overall, I'd highly recommend Mikaku for a night out after exploring downtown and it's also a great place to stop by the shops in Union Square or Chinatown. Thanks for a great experience!
author: Jony V.

description: I just called for pick up, the guy said he has no time for pick up, and hang up my phone. He is so rude for neighborhoods. Never order from them anymore.
author: Di J.

description: Poorly made rolls. Ingredients are sloppily sliced and the fish isn't anywhere close to fresh. Not as good as it use to be.
author: A B.

description: We were lucky enough to show up during happy hour and were pleased by their large selection.  They had appetizers, several rolls, beer, sake and wines available at a discounted price (averaged $5-$6).  My hubby and I shared several rolls and a large noodle soup.  Our (young) kids shared the chicken teriyaki, which was delicious.  Everything was excellent and tasted fresh!   Even the green tea ice cream we shared for dessert was delicious!  Service was also fast and courteous. We ordered tons of food and had no leftovers - enough said, right?
author: Leslie M.

description: Service was extremely slow. Waiter looked like he was annoyed when we asked questions. Sushi was mediocre at best. Don't plan on coming back.
author: Heather R.

description: This place should be shutdown due to some of the worse service I have ever seen. Server/bus boy was unable to execute even the most basic tasks of bringing water, bringing the order utensils. Several ppl waited at the door, never to be greeted or seated, leaving frustrated. I will not return.
author: Lionel C.

description: Good quality ingredients, reasonable prices and a nice calm atmosphere in the midst of the Union Square hustle & bustle.  They have a nice varietal selection for bento lunches that you can mix and match. Served with a green salad and miso soup of course.   The teriyaki salmon was cooked just right, being tender and moist. They have sushi and sashimi as well. This place has been here for a long time. It's a great place to either get some rest after shopping in the area or if you work nearby and want some decent Japanese food.  The portions are not the biggest but the quality makes up for it. The service was alright.
author: Lucy L.

description: Not the best sushi that's for sure. Portions are small and overpriced. I ordered a Diet Coke and they failed to tell me it was $2.50 for a tiny 8 oz bottle. No refills. Tempura roll came with 5 small prices. Most places have bigger pieces and about 6 of them. The California roll was the quality of Safeway sushi with imitation crab and tiny pieces. Definitely not worth it. There are way too many better places. Oh and the tempura was sooooo oily.
author: Erica N.

description:
I've been here since I was a kid...even before their numerous remodels and changes of ownership! It is definitely one of the pricier restaurants, but you pay for ambiance and quality here. 

Between two people, we spent close to $80. Definitely pricy, but at least we were satisfied after that meal. We came during busy dinner hours on a Friday night, and were greeted and seated promptly. Our server was attentive...and quite easy on the eyes as well! He was always around to refill our waters and ask if we needed anything. I recommend the Sake (salmon) sashimi, Godzilla Roll, and the beef teriyaki dinner plate. The Volcano Roll was just alright; nothing special. 

Sake (salmon) sashimi: super fresh and melts in your mouth! Somewhat pricy, but well-worth the cost!

Godzilla Roll: loved this roll since we love soft shell crab and shrimp tempura! It has a nice crunch and is flavorful. Also, the portion is plentiful; perfect for sharing. 

Beef teriyaki: comes with a side of rice, which is perfect with the sauce. Beef is not completely cooked through, so if you're a fan of that, definitely order this! This is also quite large and good for sharing.

The portions aren't plentiful for the price. You can definitely find better deals elsewhere. However, if you want to indulge every once in awhile, come try this place! It is right by the Chinatown gates, so you can walk off that food baby afterwards!
author: Kristi T.

description:
The food is ok. Not bad, but not the greatest. 
The good thing is that they stay open late and there are not many restaurants around...
The music is good. The ambient is good too.
I didn't try the sushi, so my rate is base on the chicken teriyaki I ate and the shrimp tempura. They were ok.

I may try the sushi next time.
author: Alberto W.

description:
Recommendation: Wow! This place was great. Good atmosphere, attentive service, and beautiful, tasty food! Good for a fancier sushi place if you don't want to go to a more utilitarian sushi restaurant. 

Tip: They take reservations, so call ahead if you know around what time you want to eat! 

Tip: You have to try the Volcano roll. Absolutely delicious warm roll, cooked to perfection! 

Atmosphere: The atmosphere was definitely more on the classy side compared to most of the sushi places I've been to so far. The chopsticks were a reusable dark wood, the tables were candlelit, and there were high ceilings and tasteful decorations. The back wall was a screen for a little projector that was a little hard to see, so I'm not entirely sure if that's an always-on feature or not. The music was also a little out of place, with mostly Top 40 hits being played. 

Service: The service was great! The manager came over to check on us a couple times and the waitress was nice and pleasant. Our water glasses were always being filled and the empty plates were removed on a pretty regular basis as we finished off the rolls. 

Food: The food was the best part about the meal. We got 3 rolls to share: the Volcano Roll, the Swamp Roll, and the Lemon Sake Roll. The Volcano roll was definitely the best, with delicious topping and a well-made California roll. The second-best was the Lemon Sake Roll, which had super-thinly sliced lemons on top and a very distinct flavor, even though the Lemon and Volcano rolls shared the California Roll base. Finally, we had the Swamp Roll, which was a Tuna and Onion roll topped with a bunch of seaweed fibers. It was hard to eat and the seaweed was a little overpowering, but it was still a pretty decent roll. I don't think I'd recommend it though.

Recommendation: All in all, I thought it was a great experience at Mikaku. I left feeling full and content with the food, service, and atmosphere. While I was there I definitely  thought this would be a place to take people to impress them, as everything was pretty exquisite.
author: John B.

description: Delicious fresh sushi, plus the fresh wasabi is a must! Best pork gyoza I've ever had! Great selection of sake. No frills restaurant, easy to miss passing by. But do yourself a favor and stop by when in SF!
author: Kaitlyn C.

description:
This review is for the only dish I ever order.

Sansai Soba Noodle Soup with Mountain Veggies for $13.  Though it's on the dinner menu, you can have it for lunch.

Supposedly, they make the Soba noodles on site.  I really like the flavor of the broth.  I wish it came with a few more vegetables.

It's a simple and hearty soup.  Great on a cold day.

They use a really tasty orange colored dressing on the side salad of greens that comes with the soup.
author: Roy C.

description:
Really great sushi bar I stumbled upon over the weekend. I sat at the sushi bar and was greeted by friendly and professional staff. 
They have a great selection of hot and cold sake, and someone to help you if you're not familiar with them. The one I tried had heavy floral notes and was delicious (coincidentally their best seller so ask for that because I've forgotten the name!).

I had a house salad and gyoza to start and the cherry blossom roll. The roll itself is beautiful and shaped like, well, you guessed it! I have always thought of sushi chefs as artists and these two were nothing short. Extremely meticulous and patient, cutting the smallest blemishes off of the fish and ensuring perfect size and shape to every roll and plate. Needless to say, it was very entertaining to watch! And if you're not into watching that, they do have a T.V. and big windows for people watching.

The menu is impressive and the ambiance is casual and inviting. Definitely worth a stop by!

They actually forgot to put my gyoza order in so it came after I had finished the sushi, but was almost like dessert! It was cooked just perfectly and kept me from totally pigging out on more sushi - which is not hard to do!
author: Nicole W.

description:
Short story: 

Sushi: good quality, came out quickly and was fresh (added bonus for house made soy sauce and no msg!)
Staff: attentive and friendly
Ambience: small place, but had a cool and modern vibe, that's good for small parties 
Overall: great experience and great food!

Long story:

So I took my brother and my dad here (visiting from LA), thinking this will be an overpriced sushi joint near union square. But I thought whyyyyy not! My brother has a palate that is so refined for sushi now, he seriously needs to be a food critic, so I was a little nervous about the reviews of this place. 

They were wrong. Yelpers are so sensitive!

My dad got the sansai udon noodle soup, and my brother and I ordered the double albacore maki roll, dragon roll and giant roll to share. Since I had a nasty cold, I got a miso soup.

The waiter was really attentive and helpful in choosing good rolls and made sure our water was filled all the time. Cause lesbihonest, empty water cups would lose a star.

The sushi was good! Fresh, not too salty or fishy, and the perfect amount of flavors. My favorite was the double albacore maki, it had a great garlic zing and almost melted in my mouth. It's not THE BEST sushi in the city, but it's still good for the price. 

We got to talking with the owner, Tasha, who literally is a saint, and she was telling us how she opened the restaurant with very specific food considerations (no msg; no additives; allergen free etc) because of all the food restrictions she has. 

She was a blast to talk to, and overall, we had a lovely time. I will definitely be bringing my friends back here again :)
author: Angie G.

description:
Eh.

Overly oily tempura. WAY too much coating on everything. 

Calamari that made me question if there was actually squid in there or just oily rings of batter. Blech!

Empty place when we arrived, only two other patrons when we left, but they refused to let us have a roomy table, wedged in at the back at a tight table for two. 

Overpriced wine (10$ a glass for house at happy hour!?!)

Lack luster service.

Don't waste your time or money!!
author: LA O.

description:
A girl at the Miel Salon 2 doors down recommended happy hour here so I headed over after getting my haircut by David (who is awesome, by the way). 

I got a lion king. And while I waited for what seemed to be hours, it was worth it. The fish, rice & avocado were all fresh and totally yummy. 

Looking around at the plates that people were ordering made me drool. 

I'd rather eat here than in China Town any day!!
author: AnneMarie W.

description: Loved the bento box combo. I got the teriyaki tofu and the spicy tuna. Good portions for the price. Will definitely come back again.
author: Neha T.

description: Food portion is tiny, taste is mediocre and over priced, service is very slow and not attentive at all,the only pros is it's located in central FiDi, however there are many other better choice nearby.
author: Crystal Y.

description:
When we found out that we needed reservations to dine at Akiko's Restaurant, we decided to stop in Mikaku instead. Our server told us that all the fish that serve here are fresh. 

- Cherry Blossom Roll ($15): salmon and cucumber with tuna tobiko and avocado on top
- Double Hamachi Roll ($15) - yellowtail and green onion roll with yellowtail & tobiko on top. 
- Lion King: a standard roll in any sushi restaurant, but this was the best one out of the three! 

The Cherry Blossom and Double Hamachi were both just okay. There was nothing special about them, and the rolls were super TINY! Pretty sure I would need to eat two and a half rolls by myself to be decently full... 

They do have $5 sake bombs, so that's pretty cool. I'd probably come back to drink and hang out with my friends. I'll skip the sushi though!
author: Christine S.

description:
Let me get this out of the way: the sushi was good, 4 star good. The owner has the seafood shipped from Japan twice a week, and it shows. 

Now let's get to why only 3 stars. While the waitstaff was friendly and concerned, I was not impressed with the food wait. My two business lunch companions went for bento boxes, I went for the 9 piece nigiri sushi platter, thinking that the Chef selection would expedite a business lunch. Wrong. The bento boxes arrived and I had to wait a good 15 minutes for my sushi platter. It was awkward... 

The server apologized a few times and assured me my platter was almost ready, and comped me a bowl of edemame, which was a nice thought so I could munch on something while my guests ate their bentos.

The weird thing is that when we arrived at noon the place was not busy, and it got filled while we were ordering and waiting, so I saw bigger sushi platters delivered to tables that sat after us before I was served. Not a fatal flaw, I'll be back to give it another shot, but 'till then it's a 3 star.
author: Massimo M.

description: Great service and and cozy feel. Enjoyed a hot pot of saki with my sashimi. Very attentive and hard working wait staff.
author: Tim K.

description: Very fresh fish and the waitress was friendly. We enjoyed the house sake and the Lion King roll.
author: Kenny C.

description:
Really fresh sashimi. 
The sushi chefs are friendly and knowledgable. I really liked my sashimi and it was one of the best and freshest I've had. The presentation is really cool and it comes with a bowl of rice and I added miso soup to go with.. I don't know if that's proper way to eat sashimi but that's what usually get with my sashimi so I don't care.
author: Isabelle C.

description:
Service was late and unorganized. The servers don't commmunicate well with the hot kitchen or with the sushi chefs. Was seated quickly but not attended until about 10 minutes later. Ordered edemame, shrip tempura, a volcano roll, and the "MK" roll. Took them about 30 minutes to get the shrimp tempura out, a bowl of rice with 7 shrimps. The shrimps were room temperature and soggy, the rice was pasty. After the person that ordered the shrimp finished. Our rolls still had not come out! I asked for the check and to cancel the rolls. The server and sushi chef got into some sort of argument about miscommunication. I guess he never got our order. 

All this happened with a moderate amount of customers in the restaurant. Their were empty tables. Overall a horrible experience.
author: Manuel R.

description: They have great lunch specials during the week days. The bento box is a definite must for the value.   You get so much food for what you pay. The sushi is very fresh and each morsel is just as good as the last. I usually eat here on my lunch and I love the quality of the food. I'm a big fan of Japanese food, having tried a lot of places I am quite the critic. I usually get their bento box with chicken teriyaki and a spicy salmon roll. I also enjoy their negi hamachi roll. Their nigiri and sashimi specials are really good if you're a genuine sushi lover. Plus the chefs creation roll is a must try. The rich combination of flavors is incredible and it's always fun to see what the sushi chef will come up with. They do get quite busy during lunch hour but I've always been able to get a seat. Overall,  this place and Akiko's are the best options In the area for Japanese food.
author: Beth G.

description:
When I read the reviews of some of the people who gave less than stellar reviews, it makes me sad. I have been eating here for over a decade, and I have only seen the place improve. It went from an ok sushi spot near my work, to one worth going back to my work neighborhood to eat dinner at. 
They fly fresh fish in from Tokyo a few times a week, and have special rolls on them menu all the time. Their prices are ridiculously low for what you get. 
I worked in a top sushi restaurant on the east coast, so I have seen what happens behind the bar, and they do everything right here... 

But for real, I'd be just as happy to have all of the nay Sayers stick to the hip slick and cool spots with the fancy rolls. I like sashimi, so for me, it's about the quality of the fish.
author: Jeannette F.

description:
Was tempted to give a 2 but the food was at least mediocre to decent.

FOOD - Decidedly underwhelming, no joke. 
I've had quite a lot of sushi, from a variety of places but I would say this definitely ranks down there in SF...boring tasting. We ordered 2 special rolls that sounded interesting but we were left disappointed. No idea how you use all the same ingredients that another restaurant uses but lose the taste???

*Important to note - the rolls were drastically overpriced at $14/each. This would be fine if 
1. They were larger portions 
2. They had any real taste to them

SERVICE - Not great. 
Nice enough waiters but we were left for long periods of time with no service. Meanwhile a table of 8 business people next to us was being personally attended to by the owner, offered "real wasabi" as a special gift, and got their food much quicker. Preferential treatment is a poor business practice in my opinion even if a group is spending more money.
author: Rachel R.

description: Great service. Great sake. Great sushi. What more can you ask for? (At the gates of china town)
author: Dominick S.

description: I'm here about 2/3 times a week for lunch. I work in union square so it's easy for me. If you are by yourself I recommend siting at the bar. The food is great and consistent. The spicy plum wine is an amazing combination with the sushi. This place can get very busy, very fast. It's made for both locals and tourists.
author: Olive R.

description: Great find close to Union Square and China town. Service was great and food was just right. Happy hour menu was awesome. And I heard the tuna belly sushi was the best!
author: Toni T.

description: I didn't realize I had been to Mikaku years ago with my girlfriends, but i remembered I enjoyed it! Came for a second time with my friend while on our work trip. It was down the street from our hotel. Sushi and sashimi was what I expected it to be. Service was good, fish was fresh, and the ambiance was good. My only bad comment is that the tables are so close together I can basically chime in on the next tables convo (not that I really would :P). It's a very affordable restaurant and worth the try. On the weekend if you can, make a reservation on open table to prevent a wait. ENJOY!
author: Darlene Y.

description:
The place was open on a Saturday afternoon.  My cousin felt like sushi so we went in.  I wasn't impressed with any of the offerings so I let her choose.  She chose an MK roll to split.  I also ordered green tea.  The roll also came with the house salad and we were pleasantly surprised by the presence of avocados.  

The food was ok but service was slow since they only had one sushi chef working behind the counter.  The place wasn't full of people but it wasn't completely empty either.  The roll came out and it was meh.  Sort of fishy was my thought.  I know, it's fish but fresh fish doesn't taste fishy.  It really ruined my appetite.  Luckily we we made our way to the wine bar across the street and washed it all away with a lovely glass of wine.
author: Trina D.

description: Unfunny Comedy of Errors!  The three of us came back here because we had a good experience about a year ago, but what a disappointment!  Two of us ordered the Sashimi Specials, and one of us ordered the Chirashi.  The menu states that all these dinners come with miso soup and salad.  We also ordered three orders of Uni sushi and several other dishes.  They brought two miso soups and salads, saying the other was coming.  Nothing came.  When asked about the third soup and salad, the waitress said, " You get the soup and salad only with the Sashimi, not Chirashi."  I got the menu and pointed out that all the dishes were supposed to come with soup and salad.  Then the waiter said, "But you ordered only one Sashimi and one Chirashi!." Finally, she admitted she made a mistake.  She need not have- the miso soup was room temperature and undrinkable!  She finally heated them up.  Then came two orders of Uni, though we ordered three!  Another mistake.  Then came the two orders of "Sashimi" and the Chirashi.  However, the "Sashimi" was actually assorted Sushi (the small amount of rice of each piece was covered by a rather large piece of fish)! The waiter in a Japanese restaurant surely knows the difference between Sushi and Sashimi?  I had to call her again, and she took them back, saying she had "pressed the wrong button."  Now the food itself- in a word "Meh."  Last time we visited, the sashimi/chirashi was very fresh.  This time, OK but not particularly fresh, and the Sashimi was cut into large chunks that did not enhance the delicate flavor.  The restaurant became full and noisy.  The service was as described.  Will be crazy to come back!
author: Hoyle L.

description:
It was slow on a Wednesday night. My bestie and I decided to come here because all the other sushi  joints were unfortunately closed.

The service is ok when it's no busy.
But maybe that's because you'll get food poisoning here!!

I was sketch about their label of "fresh japanese fish from japan!" And it looked like a plate of fish I've seen in the states!

I paid $38+ $5 tip, for food poisoning.
Thanks!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
They do offer a very high quality fish! Sashimi and sushi taste fresh!

Fair lunch price bento ($11 to choose 2 items comes with soup and salad!)

Sashimi and nigiri are recommended!
author: Nina H.

description:
I visited this restaurant few times, and my conclusion are: it's a nice place with fine sushi.. 
The service is good pretty quick..
Last time I was there I ordered the vegetable soup with noddles and it was ok.. But the salad that come with it on lunch time is not tasty at all:(
If you need quick lunch you can find something nice here but if you some gusts from other places look for something better!
author: Regina L.

description: Akiko's a block away was booked solid in the evenings for a few days straight, so I decided to get my sushi fix here instead. It has a pretty casual atmosphere and the wait staff is very polite and professional. They are quick to bring out your order, quick to refill your tea, and quick to clear out empty dishes. I wanted an MK vegetable roll, but they were out of some of the ingredients, so instead I ordered vegetable tempura and a couple of avocado rolls. The food was good, but the rolls were a bit small. Prices are a touch higher than some of my favorite sushi places, but not too bad considering the location. Overall, pretty good experience, and I really appreciate that they stay open so late.
author: Maria E.

description:
This is one of two sushi restaurants within 3 minutes walking distance of each other.  After being turned away at the other one for not having a reservation, we were immediately seated here.
"Suzuki?"
"We don't have it today."
"Hirame?"
"We don't have it today."
"Saba?"
"We don't have it today."
"Inari?"
"We don't do inari."
So, that brings us to the maki. 
Not much to say about the maki.
Next time we'll make reservations at the other one.
author: Rob S.

description: Mikaku was phenomenal! I called ahead before I made a reservation to ask if they had GF soy sauce because my friend has Celiac disease. When we got there we discovered that  not only do they have a fantastic happy hour with rolls and sake, but a whole gluten free menu. They reserved the best table by a window for us and the service was excellent. The staff was friendly, the chefs were fast and the price was more than reasonable for the quality and freshness. I highly recommend the overflowing sake, but it sneaks up on you quick!
author: Michelle H.

description: This divey hole in the wall makes a delicious sushi roll. Stumbled upon it after the sushi place down the street was book with reservations. Walked in and got a decent table here. Would recommend.
author: Lauren T.

description:
You know, when it comes to local restaurants, San Franciscans have it pretty good. Let's be honest, in a competitive market... scratch that... uber-competitive market like San Francisco, the law of the jungle applies to every single eatery. If you don't bring something special to the table, you go toes-up in about three months. And when it comes to the Bay Area's favorite foods, which anecdotally but undeniably seem to be burritos... burgers... and sushi... take the difficulty level up a notch from "Hurt Me Plenty", past "Ultra-Violence", and straight to "Nightmare". It's gonna be a street fight for that prime location.

So when my friend suggested sushi, I was 100% on-board, and I pretty much knew that the food would have to be good. And we were in the Union Square area so I knew that the venue would probably be cute. Sure, tourists say that they like the "real" San Francisco but then they end up at the bar at the W (not hating, one of my favorites) and not in the Mission in a dive bar.

Therefore, since the quality of the food was virtually a guarantee (and it was good), and the aesthetics of the venue were a safe bet (very cute), the only remaining factor is customer service. Here's where Mikaku earned that fifth star.

The matriarch of the restaurant chatted away with my friend, with whom she had become acquainted previously, about the topic of sake. We were all indecisive about our choice, at which point she threw together an impromptu sake tasting, allowing us a sip of her three favorites, until we chose the perfect compliment to the meal. Shortly thereafter we met Sabrina, who was to be our server for the evening. It was clear that she was having a rough day, however it was equally clear that she was in no way going to let it impact her ability to be on top of her game with us. We chatted with her, confirming that it was a tough day with some rude customers being unnecessarily mean to her, and yet she was STILL one of those most pleasant and friendly waitresses I've experienced in the city. Growing up in a restaurant, I get how hard the work is... so ten gold stars for rallying and doing a spectacular job in the face of jerky diners. Probably from the South Bay. Ugh.

So if you're looking for a cute little venue with a nice design, super-friendly servers, and a nice selection of fresh sushis and delicious sakes, and you should be, then this is your new place.
author: Sean B.

description: My wife and I had dinner here on Saturday the 12th, it was an excellent experience, great food and reasonably priced. We had Udon and a chef's Sashimi plate. Service was satisfactory. The dining room is small but otherwise, fine.
author: Jose S.

description:
Happened upon this sushi spot because Akiko was full. Was so pleasantly surprised by the fresh fish. Not fancy, and they played slow jams. So comical to me! But sushi chef was very warm and not intrusive. 

We had the:

Salmon
Saba
Uni two ways
Toro was to die for!
Hamachi
Tuna 
Tako
Unagi hand roll

Had a couple more cuts of fish that were amaze balls! I was too busy grubbing to remember the names.

Solid 4 stars for me!
author: Sonya T.

description: I love this place!! I was so excited when I discovered their great happy hour deals from 5-7 Sunday-Thursday (3$ beers and 5$ rolls? Yes please!). The staff is always super friendly, the food is fresh and quick and the prices are great for sushi in SF. I'm so glad I found this restaurant...definitely a hidden gem in the union square/FiDi area. Check them out!
author: Jordan A.

description:
こんにちわ Yelp のみなさん!

Walked into this little sushi joint on a trip to the city on a Friday night.
Limited sushi bar seating with many specials and "fresh from Japan" signs all over.
They proudly offer a small selection of fish flown from the Tsukiji Fish Market in Japan.

Food Review:
-Sake Sashimi: Hearty slices of fresh salmon with just enough fatty content. Had fresher in Hawaii for a bit less, but still tasty nonetheless; comes with Miso Soup, Salad and Rice
-Katsu Don: Thinly sliced white onion and egg stirred into a sweet broth poured over a generous slab of pork katsu and white rice. Traditional Japanese style where another egg is cracked over the katsu and rice before serving. A bit too raw in my opinion
-MK Roll: Soft shell crab on the inside, Unagi on the outside. So yum and worth it for $14
-Goma Ae: Gently boiled spinach with sweet soy sauce and bonito flakes, great portion for $4
-Deep Fried Soft Shell Crab: Whole crab deep fried to delish perfection, not something we'd order at home. But something different we had to try it.
-1/2 Dozen Kumamoto Oysters: Fresh  oysters topped with masago, green onion and ponzu sauce. Be warned, they are baby oysters! Not the palm sized ones you'll find at the Wharf

Service Review:
With an all Japanese wait and sushi bar staff, being a native Japanese speaker expedites service a lot.
We ordered a few minutes after another table adjacent to us and still received appetizers before them.
I'm not saying they are racist! Just pointing out that its often easier for Japanese speaking to get their urgency across.

Overall great food, great service at a moderate price.

TIP: If youre a fan of wasabi, try their Fresh Wasabi for $5, sure to make your eyes water and awaken your tastebuds
author: Celina Q.

description:
Been here a few times and it's never crowded. Most of the other spots I've been to can be hard to find a table past 6:30. Kinda weird but whatever.

The atmosphere is chill got this whole black and red vibe going on and I liked that. The service is good I've been waited on by a different person each time I've been there and each time they've been attentive and helpful.

I've had most of the rolls here and they're all really good. But most recently I got the bento box and it was also quite good. I really liked the sashimi and tempura. The real kicker for me about this is they have this chill sake called 'perfect snow' or something along those lines that has a higher alcohol content than other traditional sakes. That shit is my favorite. I think ultimately you can find better rolls in the area, but the deviation isn't too extreme.
author: Jim B.

description:
Food is nice. The price is typical SF prices which means its slightly pricey for what you get, especially if u intend to fill up on sushi/sashimi. 

Ordered the Oyako Shioyaki and Chicken Donburi. Both were pretty good. I'd happily come back here for lunch or dinner.  We came here on a Saturday  afternoon at around 3-4pm and by the time we left, the restaurant was half full which I thought was pretty good being such a awkward time.
author: Evelyn W.

description:
Yelp says it best: A-Ok!

I was frantically looking for a sit down sushi place that was open past 2pm during the week (for a late lunch). After walking by at least five other sushi places (three of which closed at 2 and two of which were "order and go" type places), I finally stumbled upon Mikaku Restaurant, which was open all day!!

I was seated right away and ordered a few minutes after I sat down. I ordered the Philadelphia Roll and the Spicy Tuna Roll. Each were $7, which I thought was a decent price for what I got. My food came out about five minutes later. My rolls were just "meh" and I promptly forgot about my food once I left. They were fresh, but small and didn't leave me craving more. I've had better sushi elsewhere. 

Service here was horrid. My server came by to take my order and give me my bill. That was it. No "how's everything doing?" or even a "thank you" when I left. Very cold service and very awkward. I probably would rate them higher if the service was better!

Would I come here again? Only if I want sushi after 2pm for lunch. Before 2pm, I'd go elsewhere!!

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: After sit down, we Waited 40 minutes for two entry and four noodles. And they add 20% tips for that without ask. Just doesn't worth it
author: Jing C.

description:
Surprisingly fresh sashimi coupled with attentive service earns this place a solid 3. 

Skip the Tako sunomono -- the octopus pieces were rubbery and sauce too sweet.
author: Janice C.

description: Came here to celebrate with a friend/ coworker for her last day. The atmosphere is nice. The menu looks great. I ordered the crunch California and the lion king roll. The crunch cali was delicious, but the lion king was kinda lacking, not my fav for the day. I forgot to ask what my coworkers thought of their dishes. I'd give this place a 3.5 for what I had, if I was able to try the other dishes Id give a better thorough review and maybe a more precise star rating. Service was decent, only odd thing was being charged 20% gratuity for our group.. I thought maybe Max was 18% so don't know what's up with that.
author: Rehana K.

description:
Really underrated place. My boyfriend and I were originally going to go to a Latin American restaurant until they told us it was a 1.5 hour wait at 8pm. We were walking back to our hotel when we found this place. We walked in and really liked the atmosphere of the place. Dim lighting, nice decor and a decent noise level. We decided to give it a try. The restaurant was packed, so we decided to sit at the bar.

We split 5 rolls amongst us two. We got shrimp tempura, spicy salmon, crunchy California roll, California roll and an avocado roll. We were surprised by how much food we got. Generally, when I order sushi, it's 6 pieces in a roll. We got 8 pieces each on two of our rolls and the crunch California was 10 pieces. The sushi was also delicious. Quantity was there and so was quality. The crunchy California roll must have been the best roll I've had in my life. Something about it being fried makes it so much better than the original.

The only complaint I have is the service. When we sat down, we immediately got waters. After we decided what we wanted, it took us 10 minutes to flag someone down to take our order. It seemed like there was only one person really working there. There were a few parties who were finished at the same time. This one guy rushed to their tables to clean up the space and seat the waiting guests near the door. Everyone else was chilling in the back, laughing and enjoying themselves. I feel bad for that waiter. He's the only good one. So just fyi, you'll need to ask if you want something, because unless you get the awesome waiter, everyone else will be slacking.

Overall, great place. Loved the atmosphere and the food. Think I'll be coming back next time I'm in SF area, despite the poor service.
author: May C.

description:
Why 4 stars?  It was definitely the most intense sushi roll I've tried.

   ---   ---   ---

Thanks again to the Yelp app for A) Finding this place and B) Telling me what to eat.  Without it, I would have never known about the hidden item not included on the menu.  Apparently the Chef's Special #2 was pretty popular among the Yelp community, and I was feeling adventurous.  I had a hard time understanding what all was included in the roll, but I was prepared to take it on.

What I got was an elaborate creation.  My description will be very unscientific, as I am no Sushi master.  I do know good sushi when I taste it, but I have no idea how to describe the particular ingredients.  The picture that I took is probably the best way to grasp what this roll consisted of,

It contained shrimp, lobster and some other kind of fish.  The entire plate was doused with three sauces and those delicious shaving/sprinkle things.  I wish I knew what they were, but I'm going to stick with shaving/sprinkle things for now.  I know there was some kind of spicy mayo on the plate, but again, I'm not sure what the others were.  Tempura sauce?  Is there such a thing?

Now that you've gotten my awesome explanation, I know you're definitely going to order it.  

But seriously, it is one of the best rolls I've ever had.
author: Brett N.

description:
This place is awesome! I have been to about 5 sushi places within my 4 day stay here and this was my favorite. Went at lunch but had great sushi, prices, and drinks. Right by Chinatown and union square so great location.

Try it out!
author: Taylor P.

description: I can overlook bad service if the food was good. Unfortunately in the case of this restaurant both the food was bad and the service was worse. The fish tasted old and as a sushi aficionado I can say it is the worse sushi I've ever had! No one in my party finished our rolls.... And trust me when I say we can eat, especially Sushi. I can't believe Vegas, a desert (where I'm from) has waaaaay better sushi. The worst part is that it was the last dinner of our trip up to this point the food in Frisco had been amazing. You live and you learn.
author: K R.

description: First real Japanese restaurant experience and was very impressed. Normally when we have something Japanese it's something like sushi train tonight we went more traditional visiting this restaurant right next door to our hotel. The customer service here was amazing and the food..... O.M.G. Just as good. Thank you for the experience, just another reason to come back to San Francisco in the future. Great way to finish our last night here.
author: John R.

description: Great spot to get sushi for this area at night. It isn't cheap though. Quick and friendly service. But it's hella expensive, we spent $82 for dinner for two and we ordered generously but not that much. But it's San Francisco, cheap and quality sushi isn't the easiest to come by. Sushi was good but not life changing and for that price I expected a bit better
author: Jessica Lilly R.

description: All in all, a great place to grab some sushi that is great quality. It's a bit pricey, even for the lesser stuff but if you're hungry get some! Also their soy sauce is house made, and it's the best I've had.
author: Antonio M.

description:
I grabbed lunch here yesterday and it was quite tasty.   Now I totally went overboard while ordering, but it was totally worth it.  I got the 11-piece Sashimi Dinner which comes with rice, soup and salad.  I also ordered 1 Unagi Nigiri and a Philly Roll.   For beverage, I went with a large Orion beer since I'd never had that before.

The sashimi selection was very tasty and I enjoyed the fresh fish.   The unagi, while not the best I've ever had, was nevertheless quite good.   I was only able to eat a few pieces of Philly Roll before I decided to stop eating as I was utterly and completely stuffed.

Service was good, if no frills.   All in all, though, fresh fish which is most important.   Mikaku gets a solid 4 stars.
author: David O.

description: Amazing food! Fabulous service! Would def come back next time we are in town! Rolls and sushi were great, staff was friendly and helpful. Love the atmosphere and sushi chefs!
author: Alyse H.

description: Mikaku is amazing! We were craving sushi after a long day walking around SF and we stopped in for dinner. Full disclosure, first we went to Akiko's around the block but were told there was a 90 minute wait without a reservation. We walked to Mikaku and were seated immediately. The overflowing sake was fun and ends up having about an extra shot to drink out of the lucky box. I had the Kuri Kuro dark chestnut ale and now my life won't be complete until I find somewhere locally that I can buy more. The rolls were all delicious, the tempura shrimp they use strikes a perfect balance of sweet shrimp meat and light, springy tempura, and I need to know their secret on how to tell when an avocado is perfectly ripe. The prices were fair for what we are used too, not the cheapest rolls around, but the quality is very much worth it!
author: Pierce R.

description:
Honestly the food is totally fine at Mikaku, but not great by any means. 

For lunch: the bento box special is pretty good. $12 gets you a 2 item bento with soup, salad and rice.

For dinner, the roll selection is extensive. However, rolls are overpriced. Rolls that should be $10-$12 are $15-$17. Also, be warned that the sashimi plate is a rip-off. It is 10 pieces for $25 and the pieces are tiny.

The fish was okay - not super fresh, though. I also had two pieces that were hard to chew. The two requirements for sashimi really are freshness and being cut well.

Still, I'd give 3 stars. If you're desperate for OK sushi near union square, this place is decent.
author: Julia B.

description: Udon is hard to get wrong but this was comfortably the worst udon I've ever had. It smelled like bad chicken so I avoided the chicken, but the broth and noodles also tasted off. I only managed one bite and I always finish my food. It was also just broth, noodles, chicken and a couple of carrots: no spring onions, mushrooms, bok choy, tofu, spices, etc., as though no effort was made to make this a really nice dish. Pork gyoza and side salad were palatable but nothing to write home about. I won't be going back.
author: George B.

description:
Hello San Fran, Nikki is here!

This place is across the street from the hotel I am calling home for the week. I was exhausted and starving when I arrived so I figured this would be the easiest spot to grab some to-go grub.

My order:
-Miso soup. Small in size... but makes sense for $2
-Gyoza. These were tiny little bites. They were okay.
-China Gate Roll. This is one of their baked rolls. Tuna inside... salmon and spicy mayo on top. I devoured the whole thing. Pretty tasty. Spicy mayo makes everything delicious.

Threw in a soda and my total was about $24. Looking at their menu, it seemed a little pricey for rolls. However, I don't really have a frame of reference for sushi here.

Decent little meal for my first night here. I'll sleep well tonight with a tummy full of sushi.
author: Nikki W.

description: Flew into town for work in the evening and was looking for a place to eat within walking distance of my hotel in Union Square. I was pleasantly surprised by the sushi (and shocked to see subpar reviews on Yelp). I ordered a spicy tuna roll, the Alaska roll (salmon & avocado), and hot coconut green tea. I highly recommend the coconut green tea, and both rolls tasted fresh. No complaints and the prices were reasonable -- especially for the location. I sat at the sushi bar and service was both friendly and quick. The restaurant was not busy or loud while I was there, granted it was 7:45pm on a Monday. I suggest giving this place a try if you are in the area and need a sushi fix!
author: Brittany C.

description: Went for the Happy Hour and it was ok. Service ok. Ambiance ok. Prices ok. So that's all I have to say, it was just ok
author: Melanie K.

description:
Hey folks, if you want cheap sushi, please don't go looking anywhere near Union Square, because it won't happen. That said, Mikaku provides some pretty reasonable prices for some *VERY* fresh fish.

Their side walls and kitchen area display unusual (at least to the average American palate) catches of the day, new combination rolls, and sushi you won't just find in any old place. I started with always-first-for-a-new-place tekka maki (not sure it was even on the menu, but no one seemed to care) -- fresh, firm, well-cut tuna in an art form that master sushi chefs take decades to perfect -- these guys did a pretty good job on that exacting standard.

That test complete, I sampled some or my partner's salmon teriyaki (not overcooked, moist, and not over-sweet either), and then dove into the house Dragon Roll (crisp, well-portioned, good seasoning), followed up by a very clean miso soup. I was pleased with both the speed and attentiveness of the service during what was probably a 3/4 full night.

Atmosphere-wise, it feels slightly classy, but relaxed. It's modern, but not so much so that it freaked me out, and I'm the guy who once famously exclaimed at MOMA "How the eff is someone getting paid money to paint a red canvas?!?"

Did i mention the Soju? Right, the entire reason I wanted to write this review. Some of the happiest memories I have are of the Japanese company I used to work for going out together as an office, and in the spirit of camaraderie, get *blasted* on Korean Soju, our bosses and EOs included. I associate Soju with happy memories, but the thing is, it's tastier and less debilitating than Vodka (also often made from potatoes), but it's also cleaner and *more* debilitating than Sake.

Go try some of their many interesting Soju offerings -- it's really a nice touch to an already-good restaurant.
author: Amy P.

description:
Meh. Not worth my $22. I know I shouldn't expect much especially with the ratings. However, I was craving sushi and it's the closest place to me in the FiDi. I wanted the lion king roll but they didn't have any. The lady I suggested the volcano roll which is similar but with scallops. I'm very particular with raw seafood. I asked her if the scallops would be cooked. She said yes because they are baked. So, I gave her the benefit of the doubt. I get back to work and start chewing down because it's 4:30pm and just now having lunch. Took my first bite of the sushi. Great. It's not fully cooked. I mean I know scallops shouldn't be over cooked but then again it shouldn't be under cooked. I wiped off all the scallops. The sushi was falling apart! Cmon. $14 for this sushi. You should be using sticky rice for this or roll it better so that it sticks and not fall sort as soon as I pick it up.  I just looked at the receipt and wondered why I spent $22 for lunch. $14?! For the quality? I feel ripped off. Also, the crab meet I think was the crab stick and not shredded. It literally looked like pre lacked sushi from Safeway. I paid $14 to eat California roll with sauce. 
The appetizer veggie tempura....I have no words. They looked so pathetic. It's like the veggies shrunk in size. I've gone to cheap Japanese places over by where I live and it's good and better quality/size. Of course, it's in the FiDi so that's why you charged that much? Never again   I'll keep my sushi craving to myself until I get to place with more options.
author: Sheena C.

description: Best chicken teriyaki I've ever had because it was made the particular way I like it, which is not blackened (carcinogenic).  It was super tender and melt in the mouth.  Sushi was super fresh.  Prices are so reasonable.  I met the owner Tasha at her other shop "Common Sage" on Polk and she is very particular about super healthy, non-gmo ingredients, high quality meats, etc.  She has so many allergies and is sensitive to many foods so that how she became so particular, just like me!  Can't wait to go back!
author: Deborah C.

description:
This is a reply to the business owner's response.

I am not exactly sure why it matters whether or not we visit SF often.  Would we be comped service?
author: Steph L.

description:
Went here with a big group. I had called and made a reservation and they were great at accommodating us. I ordered a bento box with teriyaki chicken and tuna sashimi. They almost forgot to replace the tempura veggies with steamed but they caught it right before handing me the plate and rectified the mixup. The owner has severe allergies so she really knew how important it was for me to avoid cross contamination.

Everything was yummy. Service was a bit spotty at times but overall I was really satisfied and it was definitely celiac safe!
author: Sarah B.

description:
We were visiting San Fran for work and decided to check out a couple different sushi spots on the same night and compare. This was the second stop on our sushi hunt and needless to say, there was no comparison.I only wanted to try their Uni, Kenpachi and Ami Ebi nigiri so this review is only based on those 3 items. 

Kenpachi - The fish wasn't bad. The texture was pretty good, it had a slight 'crunchy' texture you expect from amber jack but the taste of the fish itself was lacking when compared to one of higher quality.

Uni - The amount of Uni that came on the nigiri was a nice helping. Looked like a mish mash tho and not carefully/skillfully laid out. When I ate it however, it was still partially frozen because I could feel the ice crystals. Since it was frozen, couldn't taste any creaminess of the uni. Disappointment.
