Ami Ebi - So sitting at the bar has its perks. You get to see the sushi chefs in action putting together your sushi masterpiece before devouring it. However, it also has its downside. We saw the Ami Ebi being prepared by the chef until he took a second look at it, consulted with his assistant and threw it out. The shrimp must not have been up to par and it was not something he felt should be served. Bravo Chef for making sure that you were serving something of high quality, I appreciated that. The waiter came by and them said that they were out of the Ami Ebi and I was ok with that. What happened next surprised me. The owner came over to the chef to ask why the shrimp was not being served. He explained himself and that must not have sat well with the owner since the profits on the shrimp must be high. Next thing I know, I saw them pulling out a box of frozen.. FROZEN, shrimp. Granted, I dont know how other restaurants do it, but when I am sitting at the sushi bar, the last thing I want to see is frozen shrimp being thawed out under some water, cut up and served raw to me. The waiter comes back telling me he made a mistake that they did have The shrimp and that it was being prepared for me... Face palm.... 

Their other food might be good, but I certainly wont be back for this.
author: An L.

description: Excellent food, friendly service, great location. Great for business lunch or with messy kids.
author: Xenia V.

description:
First, the hours on Yelp are wrong -- they were open on a Sunday evening for dinner. 

Second, Mikaku is within walking distance of Union Square and very near the Chinatown Gate -- it's near many hotels and across the street from the Triton Hotel.  For those hotel guests in need of a quick meal, this would be an easy choice. 

Third, service was good and the restaurant clean.   

Fourth, prices were reasonable for the area  - less then $30 for kappa maki, Swampy Roll (8 pieces of white albacore tuna + seaweed salad on top), and a small house hot sake.  

Fifth, quality - while the Swampy Roll was good, the rice in the kappa maki was stale and there was too little cucumber in each roll.

All in all, an average go-to option for those in the area.
author: Kimya P.

description:
Great food, great service be back for sure!  Highly recommended on the miso soup and the steamed tempura vegetarian roll 

Will be back (-:
author: Keren N.

description: Came here with a friend during their happy hour on Sat.  And not bad!  The rolls were kinda small, but in all fairness it was 8 pieces.  All of what we ordered were off the happy hour menu.  The hamachi and salmon nigiri were pretty good.  So I would say a 3.5 stars.
author: M. T.

description: No complaints here. My food always has flavor, portions are great, nothing wrong so far. Staff is really nice and they always ask if there is anything that they can help you with. They always make sure to go above and beyond for us when we come. It can get pretty busy so be prepared to wait and don't complain about it. The sushi is good fish is fresh and shipped fresh daily from what I've heard. The owner is really nice and attentive and if you need anything just let her know and she will accommodate to your needs. They are also very kid friendly and they have always gave our daughter small portions of food for her since she is a baby . The place isn't that big though so space is limited. Price is average for the area it is union square which is generally overpriced
author: Yung W.

description: My meal was pretty good, just wasn't anything I couldn't get at another standard sushi joint, and I wanted something special while I was in SF. That's OK though. I felt a little bad for the waitress as there was only one waitress and the place was completely full, she was really running (tough to get water refills, no soy sauce at tables, etc). They should consider at least getting a busboy or something. The chef came around to our table and checked in and made some friendly comments, and that was appreciated. I tried about 8 different rolls. I had the Volcano Roll on the advice here and I would agree, that's probably the one to get even though I'm not super into scallops. It was tasty, and I really liked my ahi poke salad. Nothing else was particularly great. Definitely do NOT get the sweet potato roll: worst of its kind I've ever had. Very glutinous and flavorless, bad texture.
author: Alison H.

description: Quality Japanese food @ a conveniently located place in SF! I came here with the fam for my mom's birthday last night~ we were in the City to listen to the symphony & go shopping @ Union Square. Good times!! The service was very good. I was very impressed with that-- I am from the South Bay so I understand prices up in the City are about $3-$5 more. Makes sense, given the great location. Also, they had a TV so we were following the Warriors game while I was slurping my udon noodles & eating yummy sushi! Special thanks to the bro for treating us all~ basically, I was really happy w/ this place and I would be back! Note-- I randomly remembered that I had been here before for happy hour a couple years back when I was up in SF w/ my friends... so note to self-- if I ever get a job up there or am visiting some friends on a weekday (or at a meeting in SF)-- come here for happy hour! (sushi & sake.. delish!)
author: Audrey L.

description: This place is one of my favorite Sushi restaurants I go to for sushi in San Francisco I always Get The volcano roll and The Godzilla Roll one of my Favorite sushis.
author: Mychael H.

description:
I came here with a group celebrating a friend's birthday.  This place is not made for big groups.  There were about 11 of us and it caused all manner of confusion and disarray.  Mikaku isn't a big place, so that one might be on us.  

The food was alright. I ordered the una ju which came with the requisite salad and miso soup.  I always wonder why Japanese restaurants serve a salad with their entrees; it is rarely any more than a footnote to the rest of the meal and this was no exception.  The una ju, while being one of the more expensive dishes on the menu, really was very bare-bones and basic.  Eel on rice, done.  What is more, it is a fairly small portion so after I finished my meal, I was still feeling a bit hungry.

The real issue we had was with the service.  All the dishes came out a few at a time.  This had the unfortunate consequence of having some of us completely finished with our meals while others were still waiting on their first rolls.  As you can imagine, this left some in our party rather hangry for the nearly two hours we spent there.
author: Daniel A.

description:
A+ Happy Hour (Mon-Sat 5-7pm) review

$2.50 appetizers (gyoza/edamame/chicken wings)
$3.50 hand rolls
$4.50 - $7 special rolls
$2.50 - $5.50 veggie rolls
+Drink specials

Get the Crunch Giant! It's a big roll to share, and so yumyums. This has recently been my go-to for local sushi. It's not the greatest, but it's good.
author: Felicia R.

description: Amazing fresh fish and impeccable service!  We came here for our anniversary for sashimi and are very finicky about our fish.  They completely satisfied and exceeded all expectations!!
author: Aimee F.

description: This is a good place to come during Happy Hour hours, if you're looking for a chill place to hang out and talk. Cheap drinks and apps in a quiet-ish atmosphere. Convenient location. I particularly liked the lychee and apple sake cocktails ;)
author: Bianca C.

description:
When we decided to come to Mikaku we had just been craving some good sushi and a nice ambience to have a few drinks.
Everything started off pretty well. The place looks clean at a first glance, and the hostess was polite enough to allow us to sit at the counter area since all the tables were taken. 

However when you sit and really start to look at the place you'll notice that someone hasn't dusted in what seems like years. The light fixtures are simply heavy with dust and I do not wish to even know how much of it has ended up in food and drinks. 

And as polite as they were to allow us to move to a table when one cleared, we simply could not overlook that in one of our sushi orders we found two hairs INSIDE of the sushi. It was on the same platter, pieces on opposite ends of the platter, and they did not handle the situation with any ounce of grace.
One waitress promised they'd take it off of the bill and another waiter promised they'd bring us one free of charge but when it came time to comp us the free platter the waiter played dumb and swore he never said that. 
Both, of course, continued to try and keep us from speaking of the incident since the tables around us were listening in and glancing over to see what was wrong. 

All in all, clean at first glance but truly very dirty in both establishment and quality of food preparation. Our morning afterward can attest to that.
We've told all of our friends never to go and now I am telling you all: 
Find somewhere else and save yourselves.
author: Jimenna C.

description:
The food was decent (you can get better in San Francisco) but my real issue with this place was the sub-par service.  As a former server myself, I can let some things slide when a restaurant is packed, but there were at least 4 other tables open in this small venue so there is no excuse...

- Waited a very long time before the female server came to our table to take the order; no apology for the wait and didn't even introduce herself.

- We ordered 4 sushi rolls but only received 3; I have no idea what happened here as they never explained.

- We had to ask for water (wasn't just given like it should be) and they never refilled our glasses, or even stopped by to check on us to see if the food was good.

- A male server delivered our check and cashed us out, and no, the female server was not on break.

Unless this places puts a sign out saying that they've hired competent wait staff, I won't be returning.
author: Nick H.

description: POOR SERVICE. We wait too long for our food so the dishes got cold. I could see the dishes at the kitchen window but no one give it to us. They charged more than we ate. The food was ok but does not worth the price.
author: Xiaoyue W.

description:
We wanted sushi before leaving San Fran and come across this place which was nearby, we had less than an hour to eat and head back to our hotel. Ordered some rolls, but unfort i've had amazing sushi and this was bland. Didn't fill us up. 

Paid and left. Nice place, cute and clean. Bathrooms upstairs are nice too. Empty place and our rolls still took a really long time. Oh well.
author: Harlow H.

description: I like this place! It's super close to Union Square. It's pretty pricey and the sushi chefs weren't very friendly, but the food was good! Our server was nice too! I'd go back, but there are so many other places to go in the city.
author: Aja N.

description:
This place is right by the Gates to chinatown in a very touristy area, but is a little gem of fresh and interesting sushi.
There is a whole board of fish from Japan, and chef John is an engaging and knowledgeable master behind the sushi bar. There is absolutely NO MSG used in any of the dishes or sauces. I would recommend the 'golden eye' a sweet little ball of spicy tuna, quail yolk, & ponzu on a  Shiso leaf, meant to be eaten in one savory bite......yum. Ask John to be creative and he will not disappoint you!
author: Selena M H.

description:
So disappointed... We joined 2 friends here tonight for a late dinner. They had been there for an hour half or so (mind you we visit every time we are in the city and regularly send friends and business partners here). Tonight was the first time I have ever been so disappointed in staff and service (love the head sushi chef who I assumed from other visits and interactions was the owner) but now not sure ... Like I said we arrived 1 1/2 to 2 hours after our friends (they had been ordering the whole time there and ordered more when we got there... Since they had ordered stuff before us we asked to split check ... Was told this was not a problem (mind u no where in store or on the menu does it say you can not slip checks (so it was two parties one consisted of two adults and ours consisted two adults and one teenage). We ordered some drink, one roll and some teriyaki beef. No other communication with staff to see if we needed any drinks or other food. After 30 minutes we just decided to ask for out checks. Well low and behold they decided to add almost an $11 tip (20%) on my party of 3 check that was $68 and add an almost $18 tip to the other check of $90 

When I asked the head chef he said sorry I am not sure what that is. As a head chef/owner you should focus on food as well as know everything else going on... When asked waiter he said you are a party of 5. Had to explain no because you allowed seperate checks that is seperate groups ... You can not claim 1 group and no where does it state no split checks and party of 5 plus will  be automatically charge tip of or choice... Then to argue with a customer about charging what ever you felt us Wong and disrespectful... 

Hope you can get it together and get back to the place we loved 3 months ago and please train your staff on proper ways of talking to customers and know what they are taking about before they answer for you .., tonight your staff double dipped on tips and because a customer asked a question got disrespectful and rude about it

It was a busy Friday night but that does not excuse constantly walking past a middle table and not checking on them.
author: Misty L.

description:
Girlfriend and I came here when Hops & Hominy told us we had to wait an hour. Totally worth it! Their sweet potato tempura + avocado "Caterpillar roll" was really yummy, as was the Yellowtail Hamachi.

Also, green tea cheesecake. Just do it.

Felt kinda homelike, we were really into it.
author: Sam L.

description:
When I came in and looked at the menu, I realized this place is pricier than I was lead to believe based on reading other Yelp reviews. However, when I got my order I thought it was justified. Sashimi combo was overall pretty fresh, as well as the hamachi and green onion roll which I ordered.

I came here just past 7pm on a Thirsday night and found that I just missed their Happy Hour, which ends at 7pm. I gotta come earlier next time and check it out (although by quick glance at that menu board there not sure if there's much good items of interest, but good deal for drinks). The restaurant was pretty busy also despite it being a midweek night.

One reason I can't give it a higher rating because the waitress that greeted me didn't do it with any congeniality. Neither did the male staff that took my order. The older lady there ( maybe the owner) was friendlier at least.

Overall decent experience. At least nothing that warrants the infamous and narrow-minded Yelper Nobu K.'s criticism (and deleted review) back in 2010 which (from what I read) led to the owner's daughter being very upset (and likely justifiably so given the crap that Nobu often writes). At least that's my opinion (a word he doesn't seem to understand either).
author: H K.

description: I had the cherry blossom and california roll and both were excellent. Very fresh and the sushi chef was very nice
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I was looking for a place to find some sushi to eat whilst downtown, so we hit up yelp and decided to check this place out.

FIRST of all, the menu online did NOT match the menu in the restaurant -- 80% of the pricing and some dishes.

When we did get our food, it was given at small portions and it didn't taste like it was an amazing omg melt in my mouth kind of thing either. 

And the rice that was given to my boyfriend tasted like it was 3 days old ... Dry and hard.  Wait....what? Haha.

Definitely not coming back because of the unreasonable pricing and old food.
author: Mel T.

description: Just had the lunch special bento box.  The miso soup was cold and the tempura was cold and greasy.  It was also overpriced.
author: Tom N.

description:
This was my first experience here, visiting for the week from San Diego. I am quite the connoisseur of sashimi and let me tell you, these folks got it right! I had the fresh caught yagara (cornet fish) and it was exquisite. The cherry blossom roll was what my waiter recommended and I thoroughly enjoyed that as well. Though, I have to give my highest rating to the sake selection. For a mere $22 a bottle, I got the Dassai which may be quite possibly the best sake I've ever had. Granted I haven't had a ton of sake, but I was very satisfied with what my server suggested. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting from out of town that would love to try some local caught sushi in a beautiful setting in Union square. 

Ps: don't forget to check the wall of specials for the really good stuff!
author: Jules R.

description:
This place is alright. Prices are what you would normally see from a sushi restaurant in the city and the quality is mediocre, nothing special. 

I came here after a spontaneous trip to the city with my friends. We wanted to eat at akiko's but they don't take walk-ins for parties larger than 4 so the hostess told us Mikaku was the closest sushi restaurant. We made it just in time for happy hour which is a plus.

From the happy hour menu, my girlfriend and I got the lion king roll, the shrimp tempura roll and the spicy salmon roll. Again, it was decent but nothing worth bragging about. We also got their house sake which was actually discussing.

I also ordered 2pcs of the sake toro ($8) and 2pcs of the blue fin tuna toro ($12). It was good but could be better. 

They could really work on their quality but it's decent enough for the happy hour prices. I'm not sure I would come back.
author: Maria D.

description:
My fiance and I stopped here on our way back to the BART after the disappointing Ramen Festival. For being a walk in at about 4PM, there was plenty of space and we were seated quickly. Our server was attentive, but not overbearing. 

We ordered pork gyoza and four sushi rolls. Everything was fantastic. The tuna in the spicy tuna roll was so fresh (though it could have been spicier for us), the sweet potato roll was to die for, and the gyoza was so good, we put in an order for two more!! We also had a sake flight (which was pretty good considering we're not huge sake fans) and a few glasses of plum wine, which was very good as well. 

Not only did we get all of this amazing food and alcohol (we were STUFFED), but it only cost us $70. We consider it a miracle to go out for lunch or dinner, especially in this area, for less than $100. We will definitely be back!
author: Jordyn K.

description: Had lunch hear and the portions were a nice size. Customer service was really good, everyone is very nice and friendly. I got the shrimp tempura with udon and my boyfriend got a bento box. We both both very satisfied with our meal.
author: Jenna N.

description:
I've been here twice. The first time a gal pal and I stopped in for their happy hour. Even though they were near closing their lunch hour, the woman there let us in and gave us sake recommendations, really friendly. Great Happy Hour deals.

The second time it was dinner on a Friday night at 7:30. We waited 2 minutes before we were seated. At the time, it was full so it did get pretty loud. Our bill was $95 with tip. We had a three rolls between $16-$18 each and a wine bottle sized flavored sake called Hana Lychee, very tasty! It was $24. You can drop a pretty penny if you're getting their more elaborate rolls, but the basics are match the cost of many places in the city. Not the best sushi in SF, but up there and the service is great!
author: Ashley W.

description:
Not the first time here but this time I got to write a review. 
Super friendly staffs and very fast with their service. That's  a huge plus when it comes to hospitality type of business. 
Japanese cuisine has always been one of my favorite but this place rock my boat. The sashimi are always fresh. The happy hour menu offers varieties of Chef's choice and they are delicious. :) 
If you're planning to dine here after a long day from work or being in the city for any reasons, this place is a must to stop by.  
Great atmosphere with ambient environment. It's definitely a place to strip off your stress and end the night with.
author: Derrick D.

description:
This restaurant is one of the few places open in the area on Sunday evenings. 

The sushi is pretty good but the service is a bit on the slower side. My friends and I enjoyed our sushi. The meal wasn't anything remarkable for me but I would return here if I was craving sushi and was in the area.

Their special menu looks good so I would def give those rolls a try!
author: Kimberly B.

description:
I like this spot- and it's right next to my apartment. The sushi chef is nice and so are the other employees. I wouldn't say it's "to-die-for" but it does the trick! 

I usually get a lemon sake roll or tuna poke. 

Prices are pretty good too, especially for Union Square!
author: Natasha M.

description:
Not a bad sushi spot when you've got a craving and every other place nearby has a 45 minute wait. 

Surprisingly even on a saturday night there were tables available, tough SXSW driving people out of the city may have played a role. 

The price is totally reasonable, the bill came to about $100 for 4 people, even though we were starving and ordered 8 rolls. 

My two favorite rolls were the Godzilla (shrimp tempura, tuna, tempura soft shell crab) and the Volcano (baked California roll with spicy scallop).
author: Brad M.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying that I did not dine here;  a friend and I simply drank a bottle of sake here.  

It was fall and the wind was biting when we finally saw this quaint little restaurant nestled amidst the throngs of luxury brand boutiques on Grant Ave. The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly, despite our indecisiveness in seating arrangement.  When we finally settled by the window, we had a lovely time chatting in our subdued surroundings while watching the hustle and bustle of people outside the popular avenue.  Two of the staff helped us select a bottle of sake, carefully and thoroughly explaining the different nuances in each bottle they recommended.  The place was small and extremely cosy;  wonderful place for a date.
author: Sofia P.

description: Mikaku has improved significantly over the years. My favorite new thing they've introduced is the overflowing sake. It's innovative and fun! I've never seen this at any other sushi restaurant in SF. It's a great value too! Also their fish is imported fresh from one of the well known fish markets in Japan. The food is delicious and well presented. The ambiance is really cool too. Last time I went there was a cool Japanese film playing with puppets dancing. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area!
author: Kristine Y.

description:
After walking aimlessly around Kearny street area during lunch hour, I ended up going to Mikaku. 

This place catches a lot tourist since its across the street from the main entrance into the exotic San Francisco Chinatown.  This place has been around for quite a while, I know because when I started working in SF 7 years ago, this was one of the first place I went to with co-workers.

The menu is pretty traditional and I ended up ordering the 2 item Bento box.  I picked the teriyaki salmon and tempura.  The box came with soup, salad, rice and a slice of orange.  My Chanel wallet didn't really mind spending $10.50 for lunch. The salmon was okay, it didn't taste bad, but it also didn't scream deliciousness to my taste buds either. The tempura's batter was more on the heavy side, I prefer it to be lighter and crispier.  Overall, the meal was fine...okay.  Perhaps I will venture back in another 7 years...
author: Jenny T.

description:
Sushi roll was not satisfying and rolls were definitely small.  The best roll we had was Godzilla, but the tempura was not fully fried.  
Prices were decent,  but the tip was ridiculous at 18%.  That is insane for a sushi place that did not even give good service.  The spicy mayo tasted horrible. also no complimentary soup. the sushi had no taste I don't suggest this for someone who wants a delicious sushi.
author: Tarundeep G.

description: Great sushi, great service. Good prices. We are from LA and would come back here again.
author: Tony L.

description: I called Mikaku to make an order so I could eat there.  The person asked me if this was for take out. I said no I'd like to eat it there, because it takes me ten minutes to walk there. And my lunch time is only a half hour. The guy said just come in its not busy.  I persisted to try and let him take the order for eat in.  He said no I can't do that.  He said take out orders only. So I gave up.  What's the difference of ordering take out you ask,... TIME. Exactly.  Don't get me wrong, food is great. I've been there enough to be the duke. It's just this makes no sense at all. Needless to say I pass up several Sushi restaurants to get to Mikaku.
author: Jeff H.

description: I am losing my trust on Yelpers. I've been ignoring this place for months now just because of the reviews on Yelp. Finally tonight I decided to dine here and I really do not understand those who wrote terrible stuff about their sushi. I think it is reasonably priced and the quality is pretty good. Yes the server do try to push you the specials but to be honest I have no regrets that listened to her and ordered one of their specials, it was just delicious! I did try Akiko couple times as well and I think Akiko is over rated and Mikaku is under rated! One of the reviewers mentioned that s/he has been coming here for years and over one bad experience s/he writes a bad review? Again, I think I will depend less on Yelp reviews going forward :(
author: Damla A.

description: I decided to stop in for lunch while shopping. I ordered the California Rolls, Chicken Teriyaki and miso soup from the lunch special. The freshest and best tasting Japanese food that I ever had!
author: Jeremiah T.

description:
i think the sushi were very mediocre. Ended up here when Akiko was closed next door. Ordered a California roll and a 49 roll. 49Rolls are usually topped with salmon and lemon. This time it was just rice rolled avacado topped with spicy tuna that werent even fresh. I have no idea where this came from. California rolls were big fat balls of rice, absolutely horrible. Not sure if the sushi chef just didn't care or a it was a bad night, but would not be going back again. 

I hate it when sushi restraunts screw up on a california roll, its like a white girl burning a piece of chicken breast.....
author: Guang H.

description:
Food quality is worse than the sushi serve at the $9.99 lunch buffet that serve sushi. Yellow avocado, overcooked noodle, overnight hard rice and slow service.

Horrible experience. Came here with a friend's family for lunch. We were the only table plus another girl on the corner by herself. It took so long for our food to come. The corner table gal also had to complaint for slowness of the service. We ordered two rolls, two noodles, a sashimi plate and sake. We had to remind the waiter THREE times before he give us the sake. The avocado on my roll was freaking yellow! And the rice was hard like overnight fried rice. With barely any service and constant reminding the waiter what was missing, he still had the balls to bring out a bill with 20% gratuity charge!      Wtf? To be fair, when the waiter returned my friend's credit car, he said he admit it was bad service and took off the 20% for us. 

Anyway, I'd not recommend anyone to come here or at least during lunch time. It was a Saturday lunch. So no reason for them to have all these leftover- turned yellow - avocado and rice to serve people from Friday night.
author: Howard C.

description:
We got a Nabeyaki Udon and they skimped on what they put into the dishes given the price. The Udon dish was $17, and it was a half pot of Udon, 2 little pieces of chicken, some onion and shredded carrot, with few random small pieces of tempura on the side.

Atmospheric was nice but really disappointing food.
author: Claire W.

description: Mediocre sushi. Fish wasn't cut properly. They ran out of house sake and draft Kirin on a Saturday night. Given then nearby sushi options, I would go elsewhere.
author: Jaclyn W.

description: Gluten free menu and very celiac friendly staff!!! The fish is very fresh and tasty as well! Definently be coming back!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Great experience here. First time in San Francisco and my boyfriend and I came in for just a beer after exploring Chinatown. 

We ended up ordering the yakitori and fried pot stickers and both were excellent. The restaurant makes their own soy sauce and it definitely makes this sushi restaurant stand apart. Service was great, location is great, and prices are fairly cheap. Spent $30 on four beers and two appetizers. Would definitely come here again.
author: Katia O.

description: We sat at the bar and was neglected by the waiters. Service was bad. Everything was way over priced for quantity and quality of rolls. I even got a nagiri of the "fresh fish from Japan" which tasted like seawater and wasn't deboned. Left disappointed and hungry after a $70 bill (with a 3 shot flight of sake) for 2. Not recommended.
author: Nick O.

description: Came across this place while looking for sushi in the city. They were busy and under staffed, only one waiter for about 5-8 tables. So it took her a while to acknowledge that we were there! We ordered Dragon and Volcano Sushi rolls, edemame and chicken udon soup. It took a little while for the food to come and the volcano sushi roll was not riled properly because you could not even pick it up without it falling all over the table, we only ate 2 out of 6 pieces :( the volcano sushi roll was good! The chicken udon soup was not worth the price because the noodles were still hard and not well cooked and hard to eat, and the edemame was just barely boiled and not even salted! Over all I would give it 2.5 because it was too pricy for mediocre food. Spent over $65 for pretty much just one sushi roll because the rest was left on the table!! Also few hours later I had a pretty bad visit to the bathroom:(
author: sahar m.

description: It's really nice to find a sushi place open until 11pm, so that is a plus. I stopped in here by myself around 10 to eat at the sushi bar. The servers were very nice but the food took a while because there was just one sushi chef and I guess he had a lot of orders. I wasn't in a huge rush but I was very hungry. I didn't ask for anything but the waitress offered me a salad because of the wait, which was much appreciated!  The sushi was great, ask the food was good. I would definitely come back here!
author: Adrian O.

description: The people here care about how you like it. There is no way to explain how good the food is and how nice the people are. We don't know very much about California and have not been here very long and they were telling us places we should go next that would be fun for the family. The food is fresh and well cooked. The restaurant is clean and pretty. They visit with you and try to get to know you. Our waitress Natasha really cared. It was my favorite restaurant of the trip. Olivia - 10 years old
author: Nicole T.

description: Still here, but excellent service and great food so far.  Super super nice staff.  Very friendly and very helpful.
author: Brandon B.

description: Excellent quality. You will get just right balance between the fish and rice. Tempura so light and fresh.
author: Robert R.

description: I have been coming to this restaurant for several years, but my last experience a week ago was rather negative. This place used to be a nice place to dine at, but now its noisy, and the people working there are a bit pushy. When I tried to order some sushi the waitress and hostess would essentially not listen to me, or let me finish my sentence. They just keep pushing their specials, as if they wanted to get rid of some fish that they didn't want to be stuck with. When we finally did order it took them over 30 minutes until our sushi arrived, and it tasted dry, like it was sitting on the counter for awhile. I will not return here, at least for awhile.
author: D W.

description: Their food is fine but pricy for what they are serving. It's just a normal Japanese restaurant serving normal Japanese food. If I spend $19 on a chef special role I would expect something more than a few pieces of fish assembled together with egg and cucumber.
author: Sophia H.

description:
I'm from Dallas and was visiting San Francisco for fun. In particular, I was looking forward to the seafood and especially the sushi since there is the perception that seafood is better if you're in a city on the water. 

I was wrong. This place is questionable at best and I'm not exactly sure how this quality of sushi is acceptable to the locals. But hey - if you're not a real connoisseur of sushi, you probably wouldn't notice. The only redeemable part of this place is their lunch specials on Japanese beer. 

Additionally, if you're a San Franciscan that is upset with this review and thinks that this place serves good sushi, I invite you to come to Dallas and to try Sushi Sake. Give me a shout and we'll make a night out of it.
author: David P.

description: Great food and wonderful service! After walking thru Chinatown, we were ready for some food and this place is just outside of Dagon Gate.
author: Lavinia A.

description:
I stopped by here for dinner while I was out and about in San Francisco. The first thing I noticed with this place was they had slow service. When my wife and I walked in there was no hostess and a waitress told us to sit next to the table she was taking an order from. After that it took awhile for her to help us, she must have seen me looking around when we were ready because she popped out and said she would be right with us. They service was slow all night, they did have one table that was around 10 people, but other then that hardly anybody in the place besides us.

So when we did get our food we had the agedashi tofu as a starter, this was fantastic and I highly recommend getting it. After having that I thought maybe this place was underrated in Yelp and we would be in for some good sushi, but as it turns out it was not to be. 

We had about four different rolls, and on all of them they were pretty small and the fish did not seem fresh at all. The rolls that they have to as well are not as creative as I have seen in other places. We decided to try a hand roll to see if that was any better and more of just the same, not very fresh fish. 

Overall I would say the place is not horrible, and it might actually be worth the value if the price was lower, but for the prices they charge I would expect better. I probably would not come back to this place.
author: Chris S.

description:
Mikaku is a useful place to know for your no-frill-basic Japanese food at reasonable prices.  With so many 'fake' Japanese restaurants in the city, this one is 'real'.  This is NOT a place where you want to take your date, parents, or out-of-town guests.  When you open your fridge and realize that you have no food --- head to Mikaku.  

TIP 1:  The regular printed menu includes the usual basics with nothing interesting.  For dinner, I highly recommend ordering only the items on the white board on the wall that reads 'Dinner Time ONLY', and stay away from the stuff on their regular menu.  On 9/2/2006, they had items like Kampachi Sashimi from Japan ($9.85), Buta-kakuni ($4.95), Grilled miso marinated chicken ($6.25), Simmered Pumpkin with Ankake sauce ($5.50), etc.  I really liked their Aji-nanbanzuke (Marinated Spanish Mackerel with ginger) ($5.75).  

TIP 2:  Try their home made Buckwheat Noodle ($8.50).  Japanese community raves about Mikaku's homemade soba (served only during dinner), which ends with soba-yu (unless they forget).     

TIP 3:  I've never tried their nigiri, but I don't expect impressive nigiri sushi in these kinds of restaurants.   Chirashi-sushi during lunch is a pretty good deal. 

TIP 4: Street parking near the restaurant is tough, but during dinner hours, your best shot is Pine Street near Grant.  If you are not super cheap like me when it comes to parking, there is a Sutter Street garage nearby, which isn't too pricy.
author: トモ T.

description:
This was a spur of the moment restaurant for my boyfriend and I. We had nowhere else to go and ended up here after 30 minutes of walking around trying to find a place to eat, and ended up ordering our food to go so we could eat it at the hotel.

We ordered a Spider roll, Rainbow Roll, Nuclear roll, and the Double Hamachi roll. The spider roll was just okay (I've had better), the rainbow roll was good, because the fish was fresh, the nuclear roll was okay as well (too much tempura crumbs which overpowered the actual sushi), and as spicy as the double hamachi roll was I actually enjoyed it. Their rolls are pretty small too. Normally, when we eat four rolls of sushi, my boyfriend and I are insanely full, but after eating what we ordered, we were left still feeling hungry.

Just like most restaurants in San Francisco it was tiny, but it was crackin =)
The atmosphere was good and the employees were friendly and helpful. Also, our wait was actually quite fast so that's a plus. Unfortunately, I don't think I would come back here anytime soon just because their prices were out of control for sushi rolls that are just mediocre. We ended up spending $56 on the four rolls we ordered. Not cool.
author: Jorgess M.

description: Excellent sushi!  Wandered out of Chinatown and found this gem. Wonderful sushi, edamame, and pickled veggies.
author: Carolyn O.

description:
Our first choice for sushi was all booked up on Saturday night. Fortunately, Mikaku was just right around the corner.
I'm not sure how good the original place was, but Mikaku was excellent!
The service was super fast and friendly. The nigiri was totally fresh and flavorful. Yum! I was starving and didn't really feel like reading the menu, so I just asked them to bring me their most spicy roll. Sorry I can't remember the name, but it was fantastic! It had fresh jalapeno and spicy tuna. There was also tempura shrimp, which isn't usually my favorite, but here it was delicious.
Next time we're in SF, Mikaku will be our FIRST CHOICE for sushi!
author: Charles S.

description:
Best vegan sushi in San Francisco and the nicest staff. I highly reccomend the Veggie Tempura and the Catepillar Roll. I could eat here every day.

I've eaten at this restaurant and ordered it to go. The quality and freshness are consistantly top notch!
author: Scott C.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in a long time. Talk to the chef and order off the special menu for an amazing experience. Try the chef special #2 if you can, one of the best rolls I have ever had, and definitely the most/best fish.
I will go back again. Amazing and fun place.
author: Scott C.

description:
I had dinner here with a group of coworkers after a conference, and we all thought something was a little off when everything smelled fishy. (I've been to plenty of sushi and seafood restaurants, so it was beyond just that; it was almost like the water smelled fishy, too). The food wasn't all that appetizing. My coworkers weren't really fans of the roll they got; it was the first time I saw them not finish the sushi on their plates. I got the cooked yellowtail collar at the end of the night that was highly recommended by the waitress, and wasn't impressed by that either. I think the only thing I liked was the poke.

The reason this is 1 star instead of 2 or 3 though is that I then spent most of the night sick in the bathroom. So did one of my coworkers. Three days later I still don't even want to look at fish. And I've never had this reaction to sushi before.
author: Natalia S.

description: Overpriced for what you get. $6 for two pieces of skinny nigiri $12 for tiny maki rolls, no thanks. Service is good though. I'll stick to Warakabune instead. Not coming back!
author: Griselda Z.

description: Great variety of fresh fish - be sure to check out the Special Fish from "Tokyo Tsukiji Fish Market" selections on the board. Excellent!
author: Lindy H.

description: Walked into a very empty restaurant at 4:45 PM on a Friday. Was extremely hungry and craving sashimi. I googled the closest sushi bar and found this one. Didn't understand why it was so empty but now I get it. Sat down at a table by the window. My back was hurting so I sat in a cushioned seat by the window. The waiter or hostess or whomever came over to me and said that this table was reserved and tried to put me at a super small wooden table in the center of the restaurant behind a pole. I explained to them that no one was there and asked if I could sit in this table and he said no sorry. "Reserved". I asked if the whole restaurant was reserved because no one was there and it looked like no one was coming there. Then I was thinking "wow, these guys must be so so busy that there's no room for me." So I just left and went around the corner to a great Asian restaurant on Sutter. Super yummy and service was impeccable. So on the way to Niemans I cruise by the sushi restaurant and it IS STILL EMPTY!!!! I can't believe that they would be so rude when they were so empty. Maybe I have body odor. I'm pretty cute so can't be that. I'm your window dressing, dude. I wanted to walk by there like Julia Roberts in pretty woman on Rodeo drive after she went shopping. And say... "Big Mistake!!!!"
author: Marie A.

description:
Very tasty! An excellent happy hour (5-7 Mon-Sat, 10-12pm Fri/Sta) includes $2 beer/saki, $3.50 handrolls, and $3-6 select rolls and apps. The well-stuffed spicy tuna handrolls were a standout, consisting of real tuna with no spicy mayo cheats; they're a bit spicier than some places but really good. I apprecaited that the music was limitied to a good background volume. Staff were attentive and friendly, offering opinions if asked, and politely double-checked when I ordered a couple items that tend to be love/hate, such as the Ume Shiso (pickled plum).

They also have lunch combos ranging from $7-12 and Sapporo draft for $2. I certainly plan to come back to try them!
author: Bill B.

description: The food over all was great. The service was very slow, my family and I were the only ones in the restaurant and our food was delivered almost an hour later.
author: Carla C.

description:
I cannot. You know those prepackaged sushi rolls that you find at the supermarket? That's the quality you get here. 

Went here for lunch during the week because Akiko's was too full and this was the closest Japanese restaurant that seemed okay based on reviews. 

Went in during the lunch rush (12:30pm) and the place was half empty. That should've been a good enough indication to run. We got seated right away and got menus. At first glance, prices seemed pretty comparable to other places. Ordered a lunch set and a speciality roll (Volcano - California roll w/baked scallops). Because of the prices, I was expecting decent quality, but that is definitely not what I got.

First off, the Volcano roll was $16. It came with a tiny California roll with imitation crab and a few pieces of scallops. Quality overall tasted like prepackaged sushi because of how dry and somewhat hard the ingredients were. However, it was warm because they threw it in the oven. Boyfriend got the lunch set with Bluefin toro nigiri. Same poor quality. Cali roll with imitation crab and below average sashimi. He mentioned that the bluefin tasted "funny," but couldn't quit put his finger on it. He did not say this with positive connotations. 

Bill came out to $50 for some of the worst quality sushi I've ever had. Don't mean to be a sushi snob, but the people giving this place 5 star ratings probably don't know what good sashimi is suppose to taste like. I felt like we were paying restaurant prices for Safeway sushi. At least if I'm buying sushi from Safeway I know I'm getting what I pay for. Mikaku's portions were also so small that I was still hungry but didn't want to order anything else because I knew it would be bad. After we left and we actually got a burrito to split before I headed back to work. Really. 

There's so many great places for sushi in the city. This is not one of them. I don't even know how this place has more than two stars.
author: Kari G.

description: This place was absolutely terrible. The fish wasn't fresh, it was overpriced and the service was awful. I don't write a lot of reviews, so congratulations mikaku, you broke me out of my writers slump for this review.
author: Milton Y.

description:
3.5 stars. We were looking for Akiko but could not find it. Maybe it was all the green beer we just had. 

Anyway this is right on the entrance to Chinatown so we were not expecting much. But we actually liked everything we ordered! The appetizer popcorn chicken I think haha were very good. Calamari was one of the better we've had. A friend had teriyaki beef, she liked it. Another had 2rolls of sushi, he liked them. I had soba, which I liked. Service was a little slow but overall not bad.
author: Vol T.

description:
enjoyed!
the evening we were there, there was luckily a fresh delivery from Tsukiji fish market.
also, rainbow roll was tasty.
service excellent and respectful.
also like the chalk board wall menu
author: Ken I.

description:
The first time I came here, I didn't actually try the food. What happened was a group of my friends decided to all meet here during happy hour (4-7pm) to try it. We sat down, perused the menu, ordered some drinks and waited for our friends. 

The waitress decides to tell us after bringing over our drinks that they were closing in an hour to serve a private party.

We were certainly annoyed. 1) we had friends coming to meet us and they certainly wouldn't be able to eat within that time frame, 2) we were planning to sit and relax for a while, thanks for telling us AFTER we ordered?

We explained our situation and asked if there was any way we could stay longer. They said no, so we left our drinks untouched and left. The chef/owner and waitress looked at us in annoyance -- but was it really our fault they neglected to tell us such a crucial detail? There was also no signs to be seen.

I came back at a later time, recalling their drinks were decently priced and with a different group of people. I am embarrassed to say I made a very poor decision. The restaurant was empty (a tell-tale sign), and the drinks' prices increased. You could literally see the "50% off beer" scratched off on the menu. They couldn't even bother printing new ones! So we asked them what the price was -- 20% off. Oooh great, $.80 cents off a pint of beer...

But we had walked a ways to get here, and we settled with a pitcher of beer, garlic fries ($2.50 for a small bowl -- don't get it, just hit up Trader Joe's and bake your own. It barely tastes like garlic), and some rolls. Surprise, surprise...the waitress forgets my order.

"Hi, excuse me?" I ask, "Is my shrimp tempura roll coming?"Z

She eyes me hostilly. "Did you ORDER it?"

"...Yes." No lady, I'm just trolling you. OF COURSE I ordered it. "Could you check on it? If it's not made yet, then it's fine."

"Sure." I watch her as she goes behind to cashier and...just stands there. She doesn't even check on it for me?! She just stares at me, and we have a bit of a staring contest.

My friends said their rolls were decent/pretty good, but was on the pricey side even for happy hour. With bad service, expensive happy hour, I certainly will NOT be coming back. We really shouldn't even have tipped them.
author: Mina K.

description:
This was our least favourite meal in San Francisco.  We went here on our last evening because it was close to our hotel and we both love sushi and Japanese food.  Some of the reviews below indicated that we would like the fresh fish - this was not our experience. The hot food was the best of the meal for us.

Our drinks were nice (my Mom got a sake tasting flight and I got some happy hour cocktail). The setting was nice and the waiter was friendly and enthusiastic.   We were seated immediately (restaurant was nearly empty) and the food came out quickly.

We ordered the real crab California roll, the Tuna belly nigiri (I think market price was $12 for 2 pc), the shiro maguro (albacore) nigiri and real wasabi.  We love wasabi, my Mom grows wasabi, and we have eaten real wasabi numerous times.  This wasabi was so weak and bland we couldn't believe it - there was zero pungency (and I'm not looking for the horseradish pungency of fake wasabi, but real wasabi has a flavour and this tasted like wallpaper paste or something).  

Unfortunately, blandness was really the theme for the sushi - the crab had no mild sweetness like Dungeness usually has (it wasn't off, for which I am grateful!), the tuna belly was really meh, and the shiro maguro was awful - they sear it!  So instead of a nice piece of cold albacore, we got some gross pieces with cooked edges.  Blah.  We waved the waiter down and asked if they always serve it seared.  Apparently they do - it would be nice if they noted that on the menu.    

We both prefer a very plain sushi experience, so the flavours of fresh ingredients shine through (California roll is as exotic as we get, as we both love crab and avocado), and we don't enjoy fusion-y rolls with sauces and embellishments.  For plain raw fish, I do not recommend this restaurant.  We get better raw fish sushi at our grocery stores at home.

We decided to move on to their hot food, and this is where my stars are coming from.  We had the chicken karaage, and it was very tasty, with a nicely strong ginger flavour.  We also had the combo tempura, and that was quite good too (my mom liked it more than I did - I found it a little soggy) - the selection of vegetables was good.  I wish I had gone with my initial instinct to get Ten Don.  

With all of the restaurants in SF, I know we won't be back to this one, as it's just not our kind of food.  If you are going for a meal of hot food, or if you like cooked sushi, you may enjoy it.
author: Ali K.

description:
This place is around the corner from my work and I started coming here for lunch after my other sushi place took sashimi out of their bento box. 

Reasonably's priced lunch, plenty of food for your dollar.
author: Meredith K.

description:
After walking around downtown SF and showing my friends around, they wanted to eat sushi for lunch. We decided to come here since it seemed like the only decent restaurant serving Japanese food. 

One thing that bothered me was when we arrived, it was 1 pm and they said they STOPPED serving from the lunch menu. I was confused, were they trying to jip us? It seemed way too early for them to stop serving lunch. Whatever we just ordered from the main menu. I got the Cherry Blossom Roll which was basically the typical raw tuna with avocado and other raw fish. I mean it was pretty fresh, but the roll itself was extremely dinky. It was almost like they cut one roll in half to make it seem like there was "more" to the dish. 

My friends' sushi dishes looked decent. I feel like I have definitely had better sushi for the price they were serving it to us. They had a sake bomb sampler which I thought was cool. You get about 5 samples of different sakes and the boys definitely downed that! I guess the sampler makes the experience here much more entertaining than eating the food here. 

Not sure if I would come back here again.
author: Katrina T.

description:
Love this place.

Jin is a great guy who makes very good sushi. The rest of the staff are always good too :). I go here frequently with my friends and we always have a great time.

Its located conveniently down town and isn't super expensive. The sushi is always good quality and the ambiance is great! We love to saki bomb and dine here, always a lot of fun.
author: Glenn J.

description: I haven't been to Mikaku in years. Over 10 years. They specialized back then as the best tonkatsu in the city. I had it today and it is still amazing. I also decided to try sushi and a hot saki on this cold day. They actually had choices and it was just delightful. A word of caution, small size Saki seems like it's never ending. Lol. Food, atmosphere and service  awesome. This place used to have a line out the door. My guess is a product of all businesses moving from Kearney  to SOMA. Thank you for this relaxing lunch. I so needed it
author: Serena W.

description:
Wow. After reading so many of the controversial Yelp reviews on this place, I had no idea what to expect. But my experience was pleasant. 

Was it the best sushi I've ever had? No it wasn't. But I was served promptly and was treated well throughout my meal here.

Mikaku has a good energy with uptempo, party music. Totally fun, if that's what you're looking for. I can imagine that at night, their late night happy hour must make for a lively atmosphere. 

After paying my bill, the sushi chef handed me a cute, long stemmed, watermelon lollipop which I thought was a fun and playful touch to my dining experience.
author: Tara L.

description: I come here often for sushi and have never been disappointed ... the sushi is always yummy and I feel the prices are reasonable as well.  There was only one time that i was uncomfortable which had nothing to do with the restaurant ... it was the couple sitting next to us and the guy was making his girlfriend cry.  The tables are so close together it was really awkward.  Every time I come here there is never a wait and the service is always great.  Mikaku will always be in my regular rotation for sushi.
author: Halley S.

description: I stopped by here to pick up some rolls before my airport shuttle. I ordered the dragon roll: shrimp tempura, cucumber, and eel on top; volcano roll: baked scallop on california roll, both rolls were yummy and fresh, I liked how they just put the stick of crab inside without shredding it mixing it with all that mayo, I also like how they don't drench the roll in eel sauce although a little would have helped; each roll had the perfect amount of rice; the seaweed salad portion was tiny :( overall I was satisfied
author: Kathy N.

description: Lovely place.. There is not alot of sushi places in the areas. Im vegetarian and they have a variety of veggie options in the menu.
author: Andrew B.

description: I had the cucumber roll with no rice..the shrimp, crab, and spicy tuna was eh..I had better seriously..my friend had the house salad..it was pretty big...the volcano roll was small..seriously the price of just 3 things is like 35 bucks..gah..sorry too expensive for this kind of quality...better luck next time..
author: Minerva L.

description: Okay service with okay food. Came with four friends. We were seated promptly. However, the chef burned mine and my friends food and we waited over 40 minutes for our food. Overall, the food was just okay. I have had better at other restaurants that weren't as pricy.
author: Stephanie C.

description: It's a shame for such a culinary destination like SF, and such a amazing location like union square to serve such disappointing sushi. It was Safeway quality sushi! You can and should do a lot better. Please!!!!
author: Faezeh G.

description: Revisited this spot last weekend during a very busy 7 p.m. dinner seating. There was nearly standing room only but luckily got in at the bar. Took a very long time for basic water and beer service and the sushi bar was out of items, including quail eggs (WTF?) They had a great selection for happy hour and everything tasted fresh and delightful. I would have liked some edamame and miso soup with my full priced meals, but only one in our group got that. Maybe we were supposed to share? I think service suffered because it was so busy, but the food was still amazing, so that made up for it. I hope when I come again I'll get that VIP service I loved the first time.
author: Kara S.

description: This place was a lot of fun but the sushi was a little disappointing! $3 Saki bombs during happy hour and an unexpected music selection including several Alicia Keys jams made it great! Also, the pho smelled amazing!
author: Jess T.

description:
Don't get me wrong: the sushi here is not awful. That said, it is the kind of sushi you can get at a QFC or Safeway, not a Japanese restaurant in the heart of SF. Here's my experience:
- the waitress got my order wrong by two items (out of five). WTF?
- the sushi that I got tasted average. Really nothing to write home about, folks.
Now, depending on what you compare it with, you may think the sushi is ok, but I ensure you that regardless of what you compare it to, there's better places than this. So if you want some quality sushi, that's not the place for it. However, if you are looking for grocery-store grade, welcome.
author: Maria N.

description:
Came here to get a to-go order for lunch.  Ordered a Sushi combo.  The sushi was pretty good, pretty sizable cuts of fish, and reasonably priced.  

However, I was shorted a piece of sushi, so I'm cutting two stars off.  My combo was advertised as having 5 pieces of nigiri, but what I found when I got back to my office was 4 pieces.  Check your orders, people!
author: Eugene F.

description: Zeon was amazing! THE best server, hands down! Handsome, great smile and so personable! My beautiful friend of eight years, visiting me from Miami and I, had a beautiful time, destined to arrive here on this sushi mission! And, oh, hello?! The food was divine! No photos because we scarfed it all down, like that! Walking missions, on empty stomachs, to find an open sushi restaurant, aren't always easy here in the city, so we soon realized! But darn it, it was so worth it!
author: Laura K.

description:
Not clean.
Mediocre service.
Yellowtail was pretty good, but not to warrant the expensive price.  13 pieces of sashimi for $50 = $3.85 per piece!
The best part of SF is that it truly is a diner's paradise - hundreds of choices within a seven mile radius!  Don't settle for mediocre food in SF.
author: SoCal S.

description:
3 1/2 stars over all if I could, but maybe 5 for the Hamachi Kama! 

Again another good solid sushi place, but not much special about it, although the Hamachi Kama was great! Nice large collar with homemade ponzu sauce and grated radish so delicious!

Average prices and service.
author: Jill P.

description: I tried different sushi restaurant in sf, this one is the worst. The raw fish is not fresh. And tempura is tasteless
author: May H.

description: found this place on a rainy day since all the other restaurants are full....... Very under rated, nice environment and nice food.
author: Wendy D.

description: Best sushi in San Francisco! Try Chefs Roll - outstanding! Service is great and the atmosphere feels like you are sitting at home. A-must-try!
author: Fred H.

description: My sister and I stopped by here after an afternoon of shopping. Our first impression was great I give it a five stars for atmosphere, very fun and cozy! The service however was not so great. We waited fifteen minutes for a glass of water and they took another fifteen minutes to bring our cocktails. As far as sushi, it was fresh however if you are looking for a variety they need more on the menu when it comes to specialty rolls. It is a bit pricey but overall I would revisit.
author: Katie K.

description:
The sushi was alright. Nothing too impressive. The portions are in the smaller size for the price but the staff is great! 

The music is also a bit like a club's so that's cool I guess.
author: Daniel M.

description: This is my favorite stop for sushi without breaking the bank. I usually hit their happy hour 5-7pm for some great sushi and saki.
author: Sid B.

description: Delicious! The Godzilla roll is so good. The atmosphere went I went, which was right at the end of lunch time, was very mellow and quiet. It was relaxing and the ambiance was peaceful. I liked that a lot. That's all I can really say. Oh, and the service was good. :)
author: Karen N.

description: This place was really disapointing! I came here on my lunch this week, craving some yummy sushi, and decided after enjoying a roll that I'm NEVER coming back!! Eeek! I ordered the Godzilla roll, which was a shrimp tempura roll with some other kind of raw fish and avocado. They (he/she) left the tough shrimp skin on the shrimp, so every single miserable bite of my roll had the tough shrimp skin texture in it. I was very annoyed and sadly paid way too much for that one roll--20 bucks! I think the place is in business simply because the location is very tourisy. Lousy sushi!!! Go somewhere else! You are warned.
author: Mariel C.

description:
This is the WORST sushi restaurant We have EVER been to!! I couldn't believe they use IMITATION CRAB in their rolls???!! The MISO soup was tasteless and disgusting. I told the manager have you tasted this soup?? She smiled at me and said.."no" .. I asked her to taste it. She went to the cook and told her to taste it. The cook went outside took a bowl of miso and went back to her kitchen.. I imagine SHE MUST HAVE SPAT IT OUT!!  The manager came back and I said "well"? And she said, yea she's fixing it. I said ok.i expected to get replacement soups. But nothing ever came. When the bill came I said .."i am not being charged for the miso soups right? She said "no" i looked at my bill and there they were 5 miso soups. I called her back, she said "oh, i hadn't noticed that she had put them on the bill." I said , look your the manager. You need to do more than just run credit cards. You need to taste your food to make sure that the food IS EDIBLE before serving it. There is no air conditioning and it was 88' and humid(it was hotter in the restaurant than outside), the beer is lukewarm,  the rolls are lukewarm and the miso soup is tasteless?? She just smiled and said "sorry" as she took my card and rans my $163 bill, minus miso soups. 
BOTTOM LINE.. 
DONT GO HERE IF YOU LOVE SUSHI!!!
author: Betsy A.

description: The sushi was fantastic! I ordered the California roll, shrimp tempura roll, and fresh albacore. The prices were not that high for the location in the city. I don't see why this restuarant has 3 1/2 stars because it deserves much higher. Nice piece of crab on the California roll, the avocado set it off it was spectacular. We only had a small amount of food as an appetizer but It made me pretty much full sharing that order between three people. Definitely try to stop here!
author: Shane L.

description: Damn good sushi, damn good service. That's all I need to say. I'm stuffed, gonna roll myself down the hill back to my hotel.
author: Peter A.

description: Good but not great, I got 2 rolls... Cherry explosion or something like that, was best .
author: Alex A.

description:
happy hour from 5-7pm!

This place is okay overall....but I definitely had better. I ordered one of my favorite rolls, the LION KING and it was alright. Salmon was not too dry, mayo was good...but something was missing....The lion king here was not the same as THE best lion king roll I had at Sushi House in Alameda. 

I also ordered the spicy tuna roll but was not satisfied with it. Maybe it wasn't spicy enough..but it was definitely lacking. 

Will I be back? I'm not too sure. It wouldn't be my top choice but I would come back for happy hour IF I'm ever in the area....
author: Eileen Z.

description: Some of the best sushi I've had in the time I've been in the states. Would recommend the spicy tuna, lots of flavor and is actually spicy compared to the spicy salmon. Affordable prices and they have Kirin ichiban draft which is always good! Would eat here again!
author: Nemanja A.

description:
The service here, as a whole, was pretty iffy: really sub-par greeting, the waitress couldn't have acted less interested, etc. At the time, we were one of only 2 other parties, and we were barely checked on throughout the meal. 

Our donburi bowls were huge, but it would have been nice to have a few more pieces of meat.
author: Anthony P.

description: This was a very nice place! Their food was good and the chef altered the menu according to what I wanted. Cheap beer in happy hour.
author: Ashwini B.

description: We stopped in for happy hour and enjoyed the spicy tuna roll. The staff and service were great. All of the food was very good quality. Great place to eat!
author: Shane J.

description: My cousin and I went here for our first meal in San Francisco. It was down the street from our hotel and I'd previously seen great reviews. The sushi was excellent. The tuna was unbelievable- so fresh and beautifully fresh. We had one of the special rolls that was oven baked, something I've not yet had and it was great. I would definitely recommend this place, the service was great, the staff very friendly and attentive.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Japanese comfort food.  That's what this quaint little restaurant offers on the specials menu (dinner only).  The crispy taro cake tastes like Japan... and it's hard to find tasty dishes like this anywhere else in the city.  The crispy duck is perfectly fatty, and the rock salt to dip in is a nice touch.

If you must go during lunch, the 3 roll special is a great deal (get the saba-gari).  The curry with rice is also quite tasty.  

Only complaint is the bathroom... no bueno when you feel dirtier exiting than entering (read: where's the soap?!)  :(
author: s m.

description: If I could give six stars, I would. The food was really good. The menu vegetarian-friendly and I loved the house sesame dressing on the salad. The service was great, too!
author: G C.

description: This place is really fantastic. I know my sushi and it's great here. The wait staff are so sweet and accommodating. 5 stars all the way!!
author: Sarah M.

description:
So a friend from Austin, TX was in SF for business, and I thought it would be fun to come to the city to show him around (as best I could with my central valley sensibilities) and he said he'd buy lunch.  SCORE!

After a quick back and forth of "what do you want to eat for lunch?"  "I dunno, what do -you- want?", we settled on Japanese and both pulled out our phones to search for somewhere to eat that was 1) open at a bit after noon on a Saturday, 2) within walking distance from the parking garage where we had just stashed my car, and 3) wouldn't make wallets cry out in pain.  (Turns out 3 was just me, since he didn't tell me he was on an expense account, but it's the thought that counts, right?)  Yelp popped Mikaku up on my phone as a few blocks away and off we went.

I don't eat nearly enough Japanese food to know the intricate details of what things should or should not taste or look like, so I can't wax poetic on how my maguro sashimi was super authentic or horribly caucasianised.  I can, however, say that it was some amazing fish, cut perfectly to that almost-melt away on your tongue texture. They weren't little floppy pieces either; with my order of six and a bowl of rice I was quite comfortable for the rest of the afternoon.  My friend got a box of some sort (I was too busy people watching out the window to hear what he ordered) and he seemed pleased with it - I know he couldn't finish the whole thing and was talking about still being full several hours later when we got a noseful walking past The Stinking Rose.)

The service was decent.  We weren't ignored by the waitress, who had hot green tea in front of us before we were even fully settled into our seats.  The sushi chef was convivial, laughing with several different people who came in.

I don't find myself in SF enough to say  how Mikaku relates to other restaurants in the area, but I'd come back again.  A grand time was had by all.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Good: Quality food. Friend and I both had the bento lunch special with an a la carte order of sushi. Not the best SF has to offer, but certainly no the worst. Portions were just right - enough to get us full, but not too much that we couldn't finish.

Bad: Service was slow, and the place was half-empty when we got there. Took longer than it should have to take our order, bring our water, and pick up the check. Also, the server DID NOT check in to see how we were doing or to refill our water glasses. Thinking back on it, the tip I left was more generous than it should've been.

Other: Prices are decent for SF standards. Lunch for two, with tip, was less than $40.
author: Joe A.

description: I like this place a lot. Mind you, I only eat vegetarian stuff but this place is great for it. Go for happy hour - cheap great sushi!
author: Jane W.

description: Small whole in the wall sushi place. The waitress was friendly and helped describe the sushi selections.. They have cheap happy hour specials including $2 draft beers (can't beat that in the middle of the city)! The sushi was good and was on the cheap :)
author: Daisy P.

description:
Pros:  good hot dishes and happy hour menu
Cons:  service

I eat here about 4 times a year.  Their hot dishes were always good and the service was acceptable.  I went in for happy hour today the food was as great as always but the service was just a train wreck. The male server had very negative attitude and the service was pretty slow.  Sad...
author: E C.

description: Has dinero foros one at The bar. Food was good and fresh. Service was prompt and friendly. Confused my order a bit, got two salmon Nigiris instead of one salmon and one mackerel.   But it was all very enjoyable
author: Jesus C.

description: This was great sushi. So fresh! Went for lunch on a Saturday. Attentive staff and super fast service.  Will be back for sure!
author: Torry H.

description:
I would eat here again. And I would order the same thing. Got the lunch special with two items. Beef teriyaki and three pieces of tuna sashimi. Fish was fresh and taste. I loved it. The teriyaki was good too. Full of flavor and the beef was not fatty. It was $11.50 for the meal. Took about 10 minutes. Place was somewhat busy for 1pm on a Friday.

Looks liked they have a good HH on booze and light apps, only handrolls were on HH menu.
author: sierra s.

description: I came here for dinner on a weekday. This little restaurant is pretty cute and conveniently located near downtown SF. The food was pretty decent. The chicken karaage was slightly disappointing but the spicy chicken wings made up for it. I got the nabeyaki udon (chicken, tempura and egg i think). It was okay. If half stars were allowed, I'd give this place 3.5 stars, but +0.5 for the super nice waitress!
author: Annie Z.

description:
This is my second time at Mikaku. My grandma took me here the first time with a friend of mine. The first time was excellent; I had the chicken teriyaki/gyoza combination. This time I had the combination with chicken teriyaki/tempura. The chicken is pretty good (no fat, bite-size) and the teriyaki sauce is not the typical thick sauce you may find at say Kitaro. The gyoza is a hit as my grandma ordered it this time around. They give 5 pieces with sauce. I like that it's not fried to a burnt brown but just right. The tempura was not that great, however. The vegetables were alright but could it be any thinner?! I've had better and bigger shrimp too. The rice I got was very sticky for the most part this time. 

Customer service was stellar the first time but today, we weren't served often at all. It's strange how different the second time was. Tea was never refilled and when they asked, we already paid the check. No one ever checked up on our table. Minus 1 star for that. If it helps, I really like the green tea! Although the little tea cups should be bigger since I kept refilling my cup like no tomorrow.

I really liked the music that was playing the first time I came around. I couldn't figure out what station it was on XMSirius. It was some techno station that made me instantly fall in love with seeing how Energy 92.7 is no longer. Today, was some strange genre that was not exactly country or alternative. Boo, but I'll still come back for another meal.
author: Dominic T.

description: This place is awesome. Our server was attentive and the sushi was delicious. Everyone was very friendly and knowledgable. Sushi was fresh and amazing! A must to visit in San Fran.
author: Nicki P.

description:
I came here after work one day with a friend and was greeted warmly by the staff.  When we were seated, we noticed how dimly lit the space was.  It was so romantic.  It was a really nice space to catch up with a girlfriend, but at the same time, it would make a nice first date.  

The food was okay.  The quality was good, but not as great as I had hoped.  I did appreciate the soft-shelled crab, because it tasted fresh and was sweet, but overall, I've had better sushi.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Don't eat here if your intentions are to order salmon teriyaki. They probably are the most ridiculously shady place ever. The size of the piece isn't even comparable to any other place. It's not a whole filet. It's not even a part of a filet. It's a small, thin SLICE of a filet from the meatiest part. So you're essentially getting a bite's worth.

PS. I vowed not to come back but I did, not by choice! Someone took me here to lunch and I figured I'd try the salmon again to see if it was JUST as tiny and it WAS! I also pretended I never ate here before to the person, but I was honestly grumbling under my breath when we arrived! :[
author: C C.

description: AH-mazing one-of-a-kind chef specials! Great service!
author: Sheryl A.

description:
It's all about Happy Hour - lasts until 7pm.
Prices are reasonable and rolls are easy to share. For 3 girls, we spent around $30 including drinks. 

Not the best sushi in the world, but Mikaku is great for relaxing after work in a more quiet restaurant to actually hear the people you're with.
author: Christine A.

description:
Extremely good and fresh sushi! Super tasty in a great friendly environment! 

Highly recommended ! Great place to go! :)
author: Mauro P.

description: We will be back for more.  The double hamachi roll was amazing even though we aren't "roll" people.  We loved the sashimi and the sake nigiri, the selections were awesome and the fish very fresh.
author: Erika S.

description: Tried this place out for dinner on a Saturday night. Lots of people there but the two of us were able to get seated right away. We ordered a pitcher of Saporo, my boyfriend got a Bento box, and I got the China Gate Roll and a miso soup. It wasn't the most flavorful miso soup I've ever had but it was good nonetheless. When my roll arrived, it was smaller than I expected so I immediately ordered some gyoza. Well, the gyoza took about 30 minutes to come and seemed like it could have taken shorter. The waiter apologized and said a lot of orders went in at once so I guess it is understandable. The food was all really fantastic though.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
there are very rare exceptions that I would give a place 5 stars...and Mikaku is one.

Even though we were one of the last customers in the door before they were closing, the owner and the staff were very nice to take us in and wait on us as though we were there during the busy times.  The food was prompt and delicious! 

Also, double plus to the owner for coming over to our table and conversing with us during our meal and having some sake with us!  I always appreciate when the owner can take some time to come out and mingle with the customers (even if its for a shot of sake).

The friends I brought with me were visiting from Hawaii and from their reaction, the staff and owner did a wonderful job in making their short visit to the restaurant a memorable one!  I will definitely find the time to come back when I find myself hungry and in the city once again!
author: Aimee Y.

description: Seems like the place is Korean owned. Came here for a quick bite to eat late night. I got the house salad and agedashi tofu, both were good but this was only the 2nd time I've gotten tofu at a restaurant so I don't have much to compare to.. And didnt get any rolls or sashimi so i wouldnt know about their quality of fish. But the chef that night was amazing though - he gave my friend and I a soju shot each, some kind of spring roll, and a fried banana dessert. Id come here again just for the service
author: Airee K.

description: If you're looking for traditional style sushi, look somewhere else. No uni, amaebi, hotatei, ankimo, chutoro, otoro, belly of any sort, anything served alive, natto, or kama. Yeah, Mikaku is just another American roll factory.
author: Grayson K.

description:
We went right after a show at the Curran, around 4pm, and were their only customers.  Somehow we picked the only table without napkins and chopsticks, and even after ordering drinks and edamame (warm and salted, pretty good, $3) we had to get up to get some off a neighboring table.  I am normally not annoyed at that, but since we were the only ones there, that bugged me.

This place is quite pricey, but what do you expect?  It's the city, and it's right by Chinatown.  

We ordered a spider roll and a rock n roll roll.  Both were excellent.  Fresh, warm, delicious, yum yum yum.

I ordered some hot tea and was served the most perfect green tea I have ever tasted in my entire life.  The waitress showed me that it's brewed in a true tea pot, with...ok, I don't know what with, I'm just a white girl, but there was a little filtered bowl inside the pot filled with more than just tea leaves.  I need to learn how to make tea like that.  I could drink it all day, every day.

I also ordered a glass of Riesling and it was sweet and fruity, just how I like it.  My husband thoroughly enjoyed his beer as well (I forget what he specifically ordered.

Overall, good place to stop for some very high quality sushi and some not so high quality service.
author: Rachael W.

description: This little restaurant is a gem! The cherry blossum sushi was so tasty, I'd have to say the best I have ever tasted. Great service. Reasonably priced. It's safe to say that I cannot find a fault with Mikaku.
author: Kirsty L.

description: Come on Yelpers!! This place and the service ain't that bad at all. I went there with some friends on sunday night. Our server was friendly the service was good. He gave us a table by the window that overlooked grant street. We ordered a few rolls to try like the Grant ( which the server suggested), spicy scallop and spicy tuna rolls- they were overwhelmed with sauces but overall good. The guys had the bento boxes it was good value for around $18. The bento boxes came with a lot of food including the main entree, some tempura, a california roll, salad and a miso soup. I had Nabeyaki Udon it turned out to be a very nice dish with a good stock, some vegetable and shrimp tempura on the side, it was more than fulfilling for me. Everyone enjoyed their food and our highly efficient service, even in the midst of a busy night.
author: Lola J.

description: Solid sushi restaurant. Fresh tuna was delicious (from the specials menu)! Goyza was good and the baked scallop was also good. Double shrimp was decent. Short review but read my adjectives. I would go again and order everything the same except the shrimp because I thought it was flavorless.
author: Steven S.
